lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2008 nazarene compassionate ministries child development program had 123 child development centers globally that provided more than 11140 sponsorships in 77 countries and met the needs of more than 50000 children through nutritional programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the church operates 64 medical clinics and hospitals worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 11874 children were fed each week through nazarene compassionate ministries
lines.name: English

lines.value: nazarene publishing house nph the publishing arm of the church of the nazarene is the largest publisher of wesleyan holiness literature in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: nph prints more than 25 million pieces of literature each year
lines.name: English

lines.value: nph processes more than 250000 orders each year from more than 11000 churches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the third general assembly of the church of the nazarene held in nashville tennessee in 1911 recommended that the infant denomination's three publishing companies then located in rhode island texas and los angeles california each founded by a different nazarene parent body consolidate into one central publishing company and merge their three papers into one strong paper
lines.name: English

lines.value: the newly created pentecostal nazarene publishing house was sited at 2923 troost avenue kansas city missouri in 1912 with clarence j kinne a nazarene ordained minister as its first manager
lines.name: English

lines.value: the herald of holiness the new weekly paper edited by b f haynes appeared for the first time on wednesday april 17 1912
lines.name: English

lines.value: the other sheep later world mission magazine began publication in 1913 under founding editor charles allen mcconnell born june 19 1860 in valparaiso indiana died c.1950 who was nph manager from 1916 to 1918
lines.name: English

lines.value: both magazines were published until 1999 when they were discontinued in favor of holiness today a new publication
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the meantime spanish portuguese and french editions of herald of holiness appeared over the years
lines.name: English

lines.value: nph is a separate corporate entity from general church of the nazarene although it is accountable to the church
lines.name: English

lines.value: nph has a board of directors and is also accountable to one of the six general superintendents of the church of the nazarene who has oversight of nph
lines.name: English

lines.value: nph publishes a variety of books music and materials
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary label under which books are published is beacon hill press
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunday school curriculum is published under the label word action
lines.name: English

lines.value: youth ministry resources are published under the label barefoot ministries
lines.name: English

lines.value: spanish materials are produced by casa nazarena de publicaciones
lines.name: English

lines.value: music and drama resources are published under the label lillenas publishing which was founded in indianapolis indiana in 1925 by nazarene minister and composer haldor lillenas born november 19 1885 at stord island norway died august 18 1959 at aspen colorado and subsequently purchased by nph in 1930
lines.name: English

lines.value: moise kapenda tshombe sometimes written tshombe 10 november 1919 - 29 june 1969 was a congolese businessman and politician
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as the president of the secessionist state of katanga from 1960 to 1963 and as prime minister of the democratic republic of the congo from 1964 to 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: a member of the lunda tribes tshombe was born near musumba belgian congo the son of a successful businessman
lines.name: English

lines.value: he received his education from an american missionary school and later trained as an accountant
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1950s he took over a chain of stores in katanga province and became involved in politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: he founded the conakat party with godefroid munongo it promoted a federal congo independent of the belgian empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: conakat won control of the katanga provincial legislature in the may 1960 general elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: one month later the congo became an independent republic
lines.name: English

lines.value: tshombe became president of katanga
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the resulting strife and chaos following independence conakat declared the state of katanga's secession from the rest of the congo
lines.name: English

lines.value: the christian anti communist pro western tshombe declared we are seceding from chaos favoring continued ties with belgium he asked the belgian government to send military officers to recruit and train a katangese army
lines.name: English

lines.value: tshombe demanded un recognition for independent katanga and he announced that any intervention by un troops would be met with force
lines.name: English

lines.value: nonetheless congolese prime minister patrice lumumba and his successor cyrille adoula successfully requested intervention from un forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: un forces were sent under the direction of irish representative to dag hammarskjold conor cruise o'brien
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumumba's government was overthrown and lumumba taken prisoner by mobutu and detained at camp hardy in thysville
lines.name: English

lines.value: harold d'aspremont lynden belgian minister for african affairs sent a highly confidential telegram on 16 january 1961 to the government in leopoldville president joseph kasa vubu and mobutu to send lumumba to katanga
lines.name: English

lines.value: that would have stemmed from lumumba's increasing popularity among soldiers who might release him
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile soldier mutinies and unrest increased by the day at prison camp hardy in thysville
lines.name: English

lines.value: the telegram has still not been shown to exist
lines.name: English

lines.value: while being flown in a sabena dc 4 air plane to katanga lumumba was beaten by the congolese soldiers escorting him
lines.name: English

lines.value: in custody in katanga lumumba was visited by katangese notables and belgian officers who included tshombe godefroid munongo kibwe kitenge grandelet son gat huyghe tignee verscheure segers and rougefort
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumumba's execution was carried out by a firing squad led by a belgian mercenary julien gat
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1963 un forces succeeded in suppressing katanga driving tshombe into exile in northern rhodesia later to spain
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 1964 he returned to the congo to serve as prime minister in a new coalition government
lines.name: English

lines.value: scarcely a year later he was dismissed from his position in october 1965 by president kasa vubu
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late 1965 general mobutu who had staged a successful coup against kasa vubu brought charges of treason against tshombe who again fled the country and settled to francoist spain
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1967 he was sentenced to death in absentia
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 30 june 1967 he was in a hawker siddeley jet aircraft that was hijacked by francis bodenan a sdece agent
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the congolese government tshombe was going to africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: tshombe was taken to algeria jailed and placed under house arrest
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pilots of the plane britons trevor coppleston and david taylor were released and returned to the united kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the congolese government demanded his extradition to congo and his western supporters agitated for his release
lines.name: English

lines.value: the algerians resisted both demands
lines.name: English

lines.value: tshombe died in 1969 the official cause of death was listed as death from heart failure
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was buried in a methodist service at etterbeek cemetery near brussels belgium
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to his role in the death of lumumba and association with western interests tshombe's surname became synonymous with sellout to black african nationalists
lines.name: English

lines.value: * knight grand cross of the order of the crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: a border checkpoint is a place generally between two countries where travelers or goods are inspected
lines.name: English

lines.value: authorization often is required to enter a country through its borders
lines.name: English

lines.value: access controlled borders often have a limited number of checkpoints where they can be crossed without legal sanctions
lines.name: English

lines.value: arrangements or treaties may be formed to allow or mandate less restrained crossings e.g the schengen agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: land border checkpoints land ports of entry can be contrasted with the customs and immigration facilities at seaports international airports and other ports of entry
lines.name: English

lines.value: checkpoints generally serve two purposes in some countries e.g china and japan there are border checkpoints when both entering and exiting the country while in others e.g us and canada there are border checkpoints only when entering the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also united states border patrol interior checkpoints
lines.name: English

lines.value: the schengen borders code which forms part of the law of the european union defines some terms as follows particularities with respect to the eu are left out in order to emphasize general usability of those definitions
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: since liechtenstein joined the schengen area in 2011 this border station is for customs formality only

lines.value: the charlatans were an influential folk rock and psychedelic rock band that played a role in the development of the san francisco music scene during the 1960s and are often cited by critics as being the first group to play in the style that became known as the san francisco sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: exhibiting more pronounced jug band country and blues influences than many bands from the same scene the charlatans rebellious attitude and distinctive late 19th-century fashions exerted a strong influence on the summer of love in san francisco
lines.name: English

lines.value: their recorded output was small with their first album the charlatans not being released until 1969 some years after the band's heyday
lines.name: English

lines.value: the charlatans drummer and later rhythm guitarist dan hicks went on to form the successful country rock band dan hicks & his hot licks
lines.name: English

lines.value: formed in mid 1964 by amateur avant garde musician george hunter and music major richard olsen the earliest lineup of the charlatans featured hunter on autoharp and vocals and olsen on bass and vocals along with mike wilhelm lead guitar vocals mike ferguson piano keyboards vocals and sam linde drums
lines.name: English

lines.value: linde's drumming was felt to be substandard by the rest of the band and he was soon replaced by dan hicks who also contributed vocals to the group
lines.name: English

lines.value: the charlatans were known for clothing themselves in late 19th-century attire as if they were victorian dandies or wild west gunslingers
lines.name: English

lines.value: this unconventional choice of clothing was influential on the emerging hippie counter culture with many young san franciscans dressing in similarly late victorian and early edwardian era clothing
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 1965 the charlatans began a six week residency at the red dog saloon in virginia city nevada just across the border from northern california
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this stint at the red dog band members ferguson and hunter designed and produced a rock concert poster in advance of the residency to promote the band's performances
lines.name: English

lines.value: this poster known as the seed is widely regarded by critics as the first psychedelic concert poster
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the end of the decade psychedelic concert poster artwork by artists such as wes wilson rick griffin stanley mouse alton kelley and victor moscoso had become a mainstay of san francisco's music scene
lines.name: English

lines.value: another reason that the charlatans stay at the red dog was significant is that immediately before their first performance at the club the band members took lsd
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the charlatans are sometimes called the first acid rock band although their sound is not representative of the feedback drenched improvisational music that would later come to define acid rock
lines.name: English

lines.value: the charlatans returned to san francisco at the end of summer 1965 and in september were given the chance to audition for autumn records a label headed by local dj tom big daddy donahue
lines.name: English

lines.value: autumn didn't sign the band partly due to conflicts between the group and donahue over suitable material and partly due to lack of money the label was on the verge of bankruptcy and was sold to warner bros records early the following year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the failed autumn records audition proved to be only a minor setback with the charlatans signing with kama sutra records in early 1966
lines.name: English

lines.value: as home to the loving spoonful one of the earliest folk rock bands to find international success the group thought the label would be the ideal home for their music
lines.name: English

lines.value: however after the band had recorded a number of songs for the record label and chosen to issue codine as their debut single the record company vetoed the release citing the song's drug connotations
lines.name: English

lines.value: ironically the tune penned by folk artist buffy sainte marie spoke of the dangers of drugs rather than promoting their use but kama sutra was adamant and refused to release the song
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead two other songs from the kama sutra sessions the shadow knows and 32-20 were released by kapp records in 1966 as the band's first single with some copies being housed in a rare promotional only picture sleeve
lines.name: English

lines.value: kapp records failed to adequately promote the release and as a result the single was commercially unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: the remaining songs recorded during the kama sutra sessions for the charlatans debut album remained unreleased until they were officially issued for the first time by big beat records in 1996 on the amazing charlatans album
lines.name: English

lines.value: ferguson was fired from the charlatans in 1967 and replaced by patrick gogerty
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally terry wilson was brought in to take over as drummer after dan hicks switched to rhythm guitar enabling him to sing his own compositions as a front man for the group
lines.name: English

lines.value: hicks eventually left the group in 1968 to form his own band dan hicks & his hot licks and gogerty was subsequently fired from the band
lines.name: English

lines.value: tensions between hunter and the rest of the band escalated throughout 1968 until wilhelm olsen and wilson decided to disband the group reforming soon afterward without inviting hunter back into the band
lines.name: English

lines.value: the charlatans recruited new member darrell devore piano keyboards vocals and soon secured a recording contract with philips records
lines.name: English

lines.value: the band released one album with philips in 1969 titled simply the charlatans
lines.name: English

lines.value: author and critic richie unterberger has speculated that the album's commercial failure was due to the personnel changes having diluted some of the energy of the original line up and their sound being somewhat outdated by 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the release of the charlatans wilson was forced to leave the band in order to begin serving a prison sentence for marijuana possession
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original quintet of hunter olsen wilhelm ferguson and hicks reunited briefly during the summer of 1969 but by the end of the year the charlatans had broken up for good
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the breakup wilhelm went on to front the band loose gravel from 1969 until 1976 before becoming a member of the flaming groovies during the late 1970s and early 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: olsen became a producer at pacific high studios and some time later formed the swing group richard olsen & his big band
lines.name: English

lines.value: hunter founded the globe propaganda design company and his artwork appeared on many lp covers including happy trails quicksilver messenger service hallelujah canned heat and it's a beautiful day it's a beautiful day
lines.name: English

lines.value: ferguson joined lynne hughes a barmaid from the red dog saloon in the band tongue and groove
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1996 a documentary was released entitled the life and times of the red dog saloon also known as rocking at the red dog the dawn of psychedelic rock in which the surviving members of the charlatans ferguson died in 1979 from complications from diabetes were interviewed about their days at the red dog
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year the charlatans rehearsed for a series of secret gigs at the legendary sweetwater club in mill valley followed by a series of reunion performances at the fillmore
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latter day line up of the band composed of hunter hicks wilhelm and olsen were not heard from again until 2005 when they performed an abbreviated set at a memorial concert for family dog founder chet helms in golden gate park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the foursome returned to golden gate park on september 2 2007 performing at the summer of love 40th anniversary concert the show also featured a set from dan hicks & his hot licks
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 20 and 21 june 2015 the foursome reunited for the final time presenting their first full sets since 1997 for their 50th anniversary concerts
lines.name: English

lines.value: is the nickname for the high speed test trains that are used on the japanese shinkansen bullet train dedicated express passenger train routes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trains have special equipment on board to monitor the condition of the track and overhead wire including special instrumented bogies and observation blisters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the doctor part of the name is from their test and diagnostic function and the yellow part comes from the bright yellow color they are all painted
lines.name: English

lines.value: some have a blue waistline stripe some a green one
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original color scheme of yellow with a blue stripe applied to the class 921 track recording cars was created by reversing the colors blue with yellow stripe used on narrow gauge track recording cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: in build and appearance they are very similar to production passenger carrying shinkansen trains and line inspection is carried out at full line speed i.e up to on the tokaido shinkansen
lines.name: English

lines.value: meyer harris mickey cohen september 4 1913 - july 29 1976 was an american gangster based in los angeles and boss of the cohen crime family
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also had strong ties to the italian american mafia from the 1930s through 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: mickey cohen was born on september 4 1913 into an orthodox jewish family living in the jewish brownsville section of brooklyn
lines.name: English

lines.value: his mother fanny who had become widowed in september 1914 had emigrated from kiev ukraine
lines.name: English

lines.value: at age 6 mickey was selling newspapers on the street one of his brothers louie or harry would drop him off at his regular corner soho and brooklyn streets
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon however fanny moved her family to the boyle heights neighborhood of los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1922 petty crime landed mickey in reform school there
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a teenager cohen began boxing in illegal prizefights in los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1929 the 15-year-old moved from los angeles to cleveland ohio to train as a professional boxer
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first professional boxing match was on april 8 1930 against patsy farr in cleveland
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was one of the preliminary fights on the card for the paul pirrone/jimmy goodrich feature bout
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 11 1933 cohen fought against chalky wright in los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: wright won the match and mickey was incorrectly identified as mickey cohen from denver colorado in the los angeles times sports page report
lines.name: English

lines.value: his last fight was on may 14 1933 against baby arizmendi in tijuana mexico
lines.name: English

lines.value: on june 12 1931 cohen fought and lost a match against world featherweight champion tommy paul having been knocked out cold after 2:20 into the first round
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was during this round he earned the moniker gangster mickey cohen
lines.name: English

lines.value: in cleveland cohen met lou rothkopf a member of moe dalitz's out fit
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen later moved to new york where he became an associate of labor racketeer johnny dio's brother tommy dioguardi and with owney madden
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally cohen went to chicago where he ran a gambling operation for the chicago outfit al capone's powerful criminal organization
lines.name: English

lines.value: during prohibition cohen moved to chicago and became involved in organized crime working as an enforcer for the chicago outfit where he briefly met al capone
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this period cohen was arrested for his role in the deaths of several gangsters in a card game that went wrong
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a brief time in prison cohen was released and began running card games and other illegal gambling operations
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later became an associate of capone's younger brother mattie capone
lines.name: English

lines.value: while working for jake guzik cohen was forced to flee chicago after an argument with a rival gambler
lines.name: English

lines.value: in cleveland cohen again worked for lou rothkopf an associate of meyer lansky and benjamin bugsy siegel's
lines.name: English

lines.value: however there was little work available for cohen in cleveland so lansky and rothkopf arranged for him to work with siegel in los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1939 cohen arrived in los angeles to work under bugsy siegel
lines.name: English

lines.value: during their association mickey helped set up the flamingo hotel in las vegas and ran its sports book operation
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also was instrumental in setting up the race wire which was essential to vegas betting
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1947 the crime families ordered the murder of siegel due to his mismanagement of the flamingo hotel most likely because siegel or his girlfriend virginia hill were skimming money
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to one account which does not appear in newspapers cohen reacted violently to siegel's murder
lines.name: English

lines.value: entering the hotel roosevelt where he believed the killers were staying cohen fired rounds from his two .45 caliber semi automatic handguns into the lobby ceiling and demanded that the assassins meet him outside in 10 minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: however no one appeared and cohen was forced to flee when the police arrived
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen's violent methods came to the attention of state and federal authorities investigating jack dragna's operations
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time cohen faced many attempts on his life including the bombing of his home on posh moreno avenue in brentwood
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen soon converted his house into a fortress installing floodlights alarm systems and a well equipped arsenal kept as he often joked next to his 200 tailor made suits
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen briefly hired bodyguard johnny stompanato before stompanato was killed by cheryl crane the daughter of actress lana turner
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen bought a cheap coffin for stompanato's funeral and then gave turner's love letters to stompanato to the press
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1950 cohen was investigated along with numerous other underworld figures by a us senate committee known as the kefauver commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result of this investigation cohen was convicted of tax evasion in june 1951 and sentenced to prison for four years
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he was released in october 1955 he became an international celebrity
lines.name: English

lines.value: he ran floral shops paint stores nightclubs casinos gas stations a men's haberdashery and even drove an ice cream van on san vicente boulevard in the brentwood section of los angeles according to author richard lamparski
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1957 time magazine wrote a brief article about cohen's meeting with billy graham
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen said i am very high on the christian way of life
lines.name: English

lines.value: billy came up and before we had food he said what do you call it that thing they say before food
lines.name: English

lines.value: grace
lines.name: English

lines.value: yeah grace
lines.name: English

lines.value: then we talked a lot about christianity and stuff allegedly when mickey did not change his lifestyle he was confronted by some christian acquaintances
lines.name: English

lines.value: his response christian football players christian cowboys christian politicians why not a christian gangster in 1961 cohen was again convicted of tax evasion and sent to alcatraz
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the only prisoner ever bailed out of alcatraz his bond was signed by us supreme court chief justice earl warren
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his appeals failed cohen was sent to a federal prison in atlanta georgia
lines.name: English

lines.value: his heavily armored cadillac from this period was confiscated by the los angeles police department and is now on display at the southward car museum in new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his time at the atlanta federal penitentiary inmate burl estes mcdonald attempted to kill cohen with a lead pipe
lines.name: English

lines.value: this happened on august 14 1963
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1972 cohen was released from the atlanta federal penitentiary where he had spoken out against prison abuse
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had been misdiagnosed with an ulcer which turned out to be stomach cancer
lines.name: English

lines.value: after undergoing surgery he continued touring the us and made television appearances once with ramsey clark
lines.name: English

lines.value: cohen who was 62 died in his sleep in 1976 and is interred in the hillside memorial park cemetery in culver city california
lines.name: English

lines.value: *in james ellroy's la quartet book series cohen plays a major supporting role in the three novels the big nowhere 1988 la confidential 1990 and white jazz 1992
lines.name: English

lines.value: * in frank darabont's television series mob city cohen is portrayed by jeremy luke
lines.name: English

lines.value: shediac is a canadian town in westmorland county new brunswick
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is known as the lobster capital of the world and hosts an annual festival every july which promotes its ties to lobster fishing
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the western entrance to the town is a 90-tonne sculpture called perhaps inaccurately the world's largest lobster
lines.name: English

lines.value: shediac is situated primarily on route 133 around shediac bay a sub basin of the northumberland strait
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is located southwest and adjacent to the community of pointe du chene which features parlee beach provincial park as well as the pointe du chene wharf which was once the eastern terminus of the european and north american railway as well as a stopover after 1939 for pan am's trans atlantic clipper air service that featured large seaplanes
lines.name: English

lines.value: imperial airways flying boat service to foynes ireland also used the facilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: hundreds of years ago the mi'kmaq encampment of es ed ei ik was one of the major camps in southeast new brunswick
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mi'kmaq word es ed ei ik which means running far in in reference to the tide which has a long range over the shallow sandy beaches eventually transformed into gedaique
lines.name: English

lines.value: acadians first arrived at shediac in 1751 as a result of the acadian exodus from peninsular nova scotia
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the french and indian war french officer charles deschamps de boishebert made his headquarters at both shediac and cocagne new brunswick
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the autumn of 1755 boishebert established himself on the south shore of cocagne bay a place known as boishebert's camp
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year boishebert moved to miramichi new brunswick specifically to beaubears island
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war acadians returned to the region in 1767
lines.name: English

lines.value: today many francophone residents use the spelling shediac however the town's name upon its incorporation did not feature an accented e and correspondingly the official geographic name for the community is shediac
lines.name: English

lines.value: shediac bay yacht club is on the register of canada's historic places for being the location of a local wharf for nearly a century
lines.name: English

lines.value: the previous shediac bay yacht club house was designed by romeo savoie
lines.name: English

lines.value: religious make up 2001 income 2006 mother tongue language 2006

lines.value: brigid berlin born september 6 1939 is an american artist and former warhol superstar
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin was the eldest of three daughters born to socialite parents muriel johnson honey berlin and richard e berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: her father was chairman of the hearst media empire for 32 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a child berlin regularly mixed with celebrities and the powerful :i would pick up the phone and it would be richard nixon
lines.name: English

lines.value: my parents entertained lyndon johnson j edgar hoover and there were lots of hollywood people because of san simeon - clark gable joan crawford dorothy kilgallen i have a box of letters written to my parents in the late 1940s and 1950s from the duke and duchess of windsor
lines.name: English

lines.value: her socialite mother frequently worried about brigid's weight and constantly attempted to get her to lose it through any means from giving her cash for every pound she lost at age 11 to having the family doctor prescribe amphetamines and dexedrine
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin recalled my mother wanted me to be a slim respectable socialite
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead i became an overweight troublemaker she was briefly married to john parker a window dresser
lines.name: English

lines.value: they married in 1960 and later divorced
lines.name: English

lines.value: as andy warhol observed in his book popism when brigid brought her window dresser fiance home to meet the family her mother told the doorman to tell him to wait on a bench across the street in central park
lines.name: English

lines.value: then she handed brigid her wedding present - a hundred dollar bill - and told her to go to bergdorf's and buy herself some new underwear with it
lines.name: English

lines.value: then she added good luck with that fairy she has three siblings all younger sister richie who was for a time the roommate of warhol films it girl and superstar edie sedgwick youngest sister christina chrissy berlin who was instrumental in engineering the defection of russian ballet star mikhail baryshnikov and the youngest sibling brother richard berlin jr
lines.name: English

lines.value: after several years as a reluctant debutante and a failed marriage brigid berlin met andy warhol in 1964 and quickly became a central member of his entourage
lines.name: English

lines.value: after moving to hotel chelsea she took on the nickname brigid polk because of her habit of giving out pokes injections of vitamin b and amphetamines
lines.name: English

lines.value: these injections were readily available through the many doctor feelgoods in new york and perfectly legal
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin appeared in several of warhol's films including chelsea girls 1966 in which she is seen injecting herself while performing a monologue and ciao
lines.name: English

lines.value: manhattan 1972 which starred edie sedgwick
lines.name: English

lines.value: decades later she appeared in minor parts in two john waters films serial mom 1994 and pecker 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: pie in the sky the brigid berlin story 2000 is a documentary in which she tells her life story in intimate detail and breaks her diet by consuming an entire meal of key lime pies
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was known for her obsessive taping and photographing of everyday life
lines.name: English

lines.value: selections from these tapes were later compiled by anthony ingrassia to form the play andy warhol's pork
lines.name: English

lines.value: other tapes made by her were the basis for the velvet underground's first live album live at max's kansas city recorded 1970 released 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin was complicit in one of warhol's most infamous pranks when in 1969 warhol announced that all of his paintings were the work of berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: brigid enthusiastically followed this line when interviewed by time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prank led to a drop in the value of warhol's work and both parties eventually retracted their statements
lines.name: English

lines.value: the question of authorship looms large in valuing warhol's paintings to this day
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1975 brigid berlin began work as a permanent employee for andy warhol's interview magazine a position that she held until well after warhol's death
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin would transcribe interviews and knit and needlepoint under the desk
lines.name: English

lines.value: patricia hearst a close friend of berlin's who began work at interview in 1988 would observe on my first day at work i noticed two small pugs who seemed to have the run of the castle
lines.name: English

lines.value: they belonged to a woman who sat behind the front desk every day from 9:00 to 5:00 but who never seemed to answer the phone
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead she compulsively knitted ate bags of candy and tended lovingly to the dogs
lines.name: English

lines.value: brigid berlin is also famous for her prolific art which has been argued by many to have been both influential to andy warhol's artwork and simultaneously overshadowed by warhol's celebrity and own artwork
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin's tit prints were artworks created using her bare breasts
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin would dip her breasts into multiple colored paints and then create a print by pressing them down onto canvas paper
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tit prints are arguably berlin's most infamous work and were exhibited by jane stubbs at a gallery on madison avenue in 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: on occasion berlin would publicly create tit prints integrating visual art and performance art that is totally not about nudity this is about you know art she performed this act live at the gramercy international art fair
lines.name: English

lines.value: after experiencing the performance filmmaker john waters later commented i think that she's the most unselfconscious nude person [she has] great confidence for a fat girl berlin also compiled and maintained scrapbooks that she referred to as trip books volumes of these scrapbooks collecting cartoons and sketches of male genitalia were known as the cock book and included the genitalia of artists such as jasper johns robert rauschenberg and warhol
lines.name: English

lines.value: three volumes of the cock book sold for $175000 at auction to artist richard prince
lines.name: English

lines.value: both berlin and warhol used the medium of polaroid photography obsessively and are said to have been very competitive in the polaroid film department whether over the best equipment or the best film
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1969 1970 german art dealer heiner friedrich did a small showing of berlin's work called polaroids and tapes and created a catalogue for the work of the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: the experimental nature of berlin's double exposed polaroids transcend the static emotionless icon polaroids of warhol's clearly showing the power of her personal vision and photographic style
lines.name: English

lines.value: common subject matter of berlin's polaroids are self portraits warhol superstars other artists and celebrities and off broadway one woman shows
lines.name: English

lines.value: berlin's digitized archives were published in 2015 as brigid berlin polaroids with a foreword by john waters
lines.name: English

lines.value: a review of the book in the wall street journal notes that berlin was also the first person andy warhol allowed to photograph his body after the 1968 assassination attempt
lines.name: English

lines.value: the supreme people's assembly chosongul    is the unicameral legislature of the democratic people's republic of korea dprk commonly known as north korea
lines.name: English

lines.value: it consists of one deputy from each of 687 constituencies elected to five year terms
lines.name: English

lines.value: the constitution recognizes the workers party as the leading party of the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: the workers party led by kim jong un governs the dprk in a monopoly coalition with the social democratic party and the chondoist chongu party called the democratic front for the reunification of the fatherland
lines.name: English

lines.value: elections are held in five year intervals the most recent taking place in 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the supreme people's assembly is the primary legislative body of the dprk it ordinarily delegates authority to the smaller and more powerful presidium chosen from among its members
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the 1972 constitution the number of seats in the assembly was 655
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was increased to 687 following the 1986 election
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1990 the composition of the spa was 601 seats held by the workers party of korea 51 seats held by the korean social democratic party 22 seats held by the chondoist chongu party and 13 seats held by independents
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last convention during kim il sung's government took place in april 1994 three months before his death
lines.name: English

lines.value: then during the mourning period the assembly did not meet nor did elections take place
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next meeting convened in september 1998 four years after kim's death
lines.name: English

lines.value: kim jong il did not make a speech at the first session of the 10th spa in 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead members listened to a tape recorded speech of the late kim il sung which was made at the first session of the 9th spa in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: the enhanced status of the korean people's army was anticipated by the spa election july 1998 when 101 military officials were elected out of 687 delegates
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was a large increase from the 57 military officials elected during the 9th spa in 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: kim yong nam has been president of the assembly presidum since 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: choe thae bok kim wan su and hong son ok are the vice chairmen
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 14 2012 during the fifth session of the 12th supreme people's assembly kim jong un was elected as the country's supreme leader
lines.name: English

lines.value: addressing the spa session kim yong nam president of the spa presidium said kim's accession to the dprk's top post reflected the ardent desire and unanimous will of all the party members servicepersons and other people
lines.name: English

lines.value: his status as leader was reaffirmed when he was elected unopposed on march 9 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: kim had nominated to represent his district the symbolic mount paekduto in the assembly election
lines.name: English

lines.value: voters could vote yes or no with all voting in the affirmative according to government officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2017 the assembly created a subordinate diplomatic commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: this may be useful for international dialogue with other parliaments while other diplomatic channels are blocked
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the constitution of north korea all citizens 17 and older regardless of party affiliation political views or religion are eligible to be elected to the legislature and vote in elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: all candidates are selected by the democratic front for the reunification of the fatherland in mass meetings held to decide which candidates will be nominated and their names can only go on the ballot paper with the approval of the meeting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the democratic front for the reunification of the fatherland is a popular front dominated by the korean worker's party in which almost all power rests
lines.name: English

lines.value: the other participants in the coalition include the two other de facto legal political parties the korean social democratic party and the chondoist chongu party as well as various other member organizations including social groups and youth groups such as the korean section of the pioneer movement the kimilsungist kimjongilist youth league the korean democratic women's league and the red cross society of the democratic people's republic of korea
lines.name: English

lines.value: elections are ostensibly by secret ballot
lines.name: English

lines.value: however only one candidate who has been selected by the democratic front for the reunification of the fatherland appears on the ballot
lines.name: English

lines.value: a voter may cross off the candidate's name to vote against them
lines.name: English

lines.value: however anyone voting against the front's candidate must do so without any secrecy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in most polling stations the voter must do so with a red pen next to the ballot box in sight of electoral officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: at some polling stations there is a separate ballot box for no votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: many north korean defectors claim such an act of defiance is too risky to attempt
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the constitution of north korea it is the highest organ of state power in the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: the assembly is convened once or twice a year in regular sessions of several days each
lines.name: English

lines.value: at all other times the presidium acts for the assembly
lines.name: English

lines.value: extraordinary sessions of the assembly can also meet when called by the presidium or by one third of the assembly deputies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the functions of the spa are
lines.name: English

lines.value: the presidium exercises legislative power when the spa is in recess which occurs during all but a few days of every year
lines.name: English

lines.value: for all intents and purposes it is the highest organ of state power in north korea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the presidium consists of the president vice presidents secretaries and other members
lines.name: English

lines.value: the functions of the presidium are to
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the 1998 constitution the presidium and the president of the presidium succeed the assembly's standing committee and the chairman of the standing committee
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the creation of the post of president of the dprk in 1972 the chairman of the standing committee was the country's de jure head of state
lines.name: English

lines.value: currently the chairman of the assembly is the spa speaker while the president of the presidium is the nominal head of state
lines.name: English

lines.value: kim yong nam is the current president of the presidium and as such de jure head of state of north korea
lines.name: English

lines.value: kid dracula makes a brief cameo in the interactive game twinbee paradise in donburishima

lines.value: st helens is the largest town on the north east coast of tasmania australia on georges bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is known as the game fishing capital of tasmania and is also renowned for its oysters as are some other areas of tasmania
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is located on the tasman highway about 160 km east of tasmania's second largest city launceston
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 2000s the town was one of the fastest growing areas of tasmania and reached a population of 2049 at the 2006 census
lines.name: English

lines.value: st helens is part of the break o'day council a council that includes the nearby town of binalong bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of shops can be found in the town along cecilia street such as a supa iga and gallery parnella
lines.name: English

lines.value: st helens was first used as a whaling base in the early 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: when tin was discovered in the surrounding area in the 1870s st helens became the shipping port for the mines
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was the first time a coach service had been introduced to the town previous access had only been by sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town was named after st helens isle of wight
lines.name: English

lines.value: today the town is a popular resort for fishing swimming and other aquatic activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: its economy is based largely on tourism fishing and timber
lines.name: English

lines.value: georges bay post office opened on 1 april 1869 and was renamed st helen's in 1882
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first european to explore the st helens area was captain tobias furneaux who sailed up the coast in 1773
lines.name: English

lines.value: he named the southern point of georges bay st helens point
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the 1830s georges bay was being used by whalers and sealers
lines.name: English

lines.value: not surprisingly the settlement which grew up on the shore became known as georges bay and the local aborigines became known as the georges bay tribe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first official land grant was provided in 1830 and in 1835 the small village was renamed st helens
lines.name: English

lines.value: it would have continued to be an inconsequential port had not tin been discovered at blue tier in 1874
lines.name: English

lines.value: suddenly the port and the routes to the tin mines were awash with miners
lines.name: English

lines.value: over 1000 chinese moved through the port
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1874 until the turn of the century the tin mines prospered
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the mines closed the miners moved to the coast and many of them settled in st helens
lines.name: English

lines.value: slowly the port changed so that today it has a major fishing fleet which is supported by boat building ships chandlery and other ancillary activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent times tourism driven by fishing and the town's mild climate has become important
lines.name: English

lines.value: notable residents of st helens include lee hartney from the smith street band & tom busby from luca brasi
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town is adjacent to the st helens important bird area identified as such by birdlife international because of its importance as a breeding site for seabirds and waders
lines.name: English

lines.value: 35 km to the west is mount victoria forest reserve near the high st columba falls
lines.name: English

lines.value: st helens has a mild temperate climate with four distinct seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: summers are warm and sunny and winters are cool to mild
lines.name: English

lines.value: rain falls consistently through the year peaking slightly in winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: being on the east coast st helens winter temperatures are warmer than most parts of tasmania
lines.name: English

lines.value: summer temperatures are not as warm as inland areas however are still warmer than experienced in hobart
lines.name: English

lines.value: st helens record high temperature is recorded on 30 january 2009 the equal second highest temperature recorded in tasmania
lines.name: English

lines.value: * st helens airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity is the degree to which a test measures what it claims or purports to be measuring in the classical model of test validity construct validity is one of three main types of validity evidence alongside content validity and criterion validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: modern validity theory defines construct validity as the overarching concern of validity research subsuming all other types of validity evidence
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity is the appropriateness of inferences made on the basis of observations or measurements often test scores specifically whether a test measures the intended construct
lines.name: English

lines.value: constructs are abstractions that are deliberately created by researchers in order to conceptualize the latent variable which is correlated with scores on a given measure although it is not directly observable
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity examines the question does the measure behave like the theory says a measure of that construct should behave
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity is essential to the perceived overall validity of the test
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity is particularly important in the social sciences psychology psychometrics and language studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: psychologists such as samuel messick 1998 have pushed for a unified view of construct validity ...as an integrated evaluative judgment of the degree to which empirical evidence and theoretical rationales support the adequacy and appropriateness of inferences and actions based on test scores key to construct validity are the theoretical ideas behind the trait under consideration i.e the concepts that organize how aspects of personality intelligence etc are viewed
lines.name: English

lines.value: paul meehl states that the best construct is the one around which we can build the greatest number of inferences in the most direct fashion scale purification i.e the process of eliminating items from multi item scales wieland et al 2017 can influence construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: a framework presented by wieland et al 2017 highlights that both statistical and judgmental criteria need to be taken under consideration when making scale purification decision
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout the 1940s scientists had been trying to come up with ways to validate experiments prior to publishing them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the result of this was a myriad of different validities intrinsic validity face validity logical validity empirical validity etc
lines.name: English

lines.value: this made it difficult to tell which ones were actually the same and which ones were not useful at all
lines.name: English

lines.value: until the middle of the 1950s there were very few universally accepted methods to validate psychological experiments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main reason for this was because no one had figured out exactly which qualities of the experiments should be looked at before publishing
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1950 and 1954 the apa committee on psychological tests met and discussed the issues surrounding the validation of psychological experiments
lines.name: English

lines.value: around this time the term construct validity was first coined by paul meehl and lee cronbach in their seminal article " validity in psychological tests
lines.name: English

lines.value: they noted the idea of construct validity was not new at that point
lines.name: English

lines.value: rather it was a combinations of many different types of validity dealing with theoretical concepts
lines.name: English

lines.value: they proposed the following three steps to evaluate construct validity in the 1970s there was growing debate between theorist who began to see construct validity as the dominant model pushing towards a more unified theory of validity and those who continued to work from multiple validity frameworks
lines.name: English

lines.value: many psychologists and education researchers saw predictive concurrent and content validities as essentially ad hoc construct validity was the whole of validity from a scientific point of view in the 1974 version of the standards for educational and psychological testing the inter relatedness of the three different aspects of validity was recognized these aspects of validity can be discussed independently but only for convenience
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are interrelated operationally and logically only rarely is one of them alone important in a particular situation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1989 messick presented a new conceptualization of construct validity as a unified and multi faceted concept
lines.name: English

lines.value: under this framework all forms of validity are connected to and are dependent on the quality of the construct
lines.name: English

lines.value: he noted that a unified theory was not his own idea but rather the culmination of debate and discussion within the scientific community over the preceding decades
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are six aspects of construct validity in messick's unified theory of construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: they examine six items that measure the quality of a test's construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: evaluation of construct validity requires that the correlations of the measure be examined in regard to variables that are known to be related to the construct purportedly measured by the instrument being evaluated or for which there are theoretical grounds for expecting it to be related
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is consistent with the multitrait multimethod matrix mtmm of examining construct validity described in campbell and fiske's landmark paper 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are other methods to evaluate construct validity besides mtmm
lines.name: English

lines.value: it can be evaluated through different forms of factor analysis structural equation modeling sem and other statistical evaluations
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is important to note that a single study does not prove construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: rather it is a continuous process of evaluation reevaluation refinement and development
lines.name: English

lines.value: correlations that fit the expected pattern contribute evidence of construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: construct validity is a judgment based on the accumulation of correlations from numerous studies using the instrument being evaluated
lines.name: English

lines.value: most researchers attempt to test the construct validity before the main research
lines.name: English

lines.value: to do this pilot studies may be utilized
lines.name: English

lines.value: pilot studies are small scale preliminary studies aimed at testing the feasibility of a full scale test
lines.name: English

lines.value: these pilot studies establish the strength of their research and allow them to make any necessary adjustments
lines.name: English

lines.value: another method is the known groups technique which involves administering the measurement instrument to groups expected to differ due to known characteristics
lines.name: English

lines.value: hypothesized relationship testing involves logical analysis based on theory or prior research
lines.name: English

lines.value: intervention studies are yet another method of evaluating construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: intervention studies where a group with low scores in the construct is tested taught the construct and then remeasured can demonstrate a test's construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: if there is a significant difference pre test and post test which are analyzed by statistical tests then this may demonstrate good construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: convergent and discriminant validity are the two subtypes of validity that make up construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: convergent validity refers to the degree to which two measures of constructs that theoretically should be related are in fact related
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast discriminant validity tests whether concepts or measurements that are supposed to be unrelated are in fact unrelated
lines.name: English

lines.value: take for example a construct of general happiness
lines.name: English

lines.value: if a measure of general happiness had convergent validity then constructs similar to happiness satisfaction contentment cheerfulness etc should relate closely to the measure of general happiness
lines.name: English

lines.value: if this measure has discriminate validity then constructs that are not supposed to be related to general happiness sadness depression despair etc should not relate to the measure of general happiness
lines.name: English

lines.value: measures can have one of the subtypes of construct validity and not the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: using the example of general happiness a researcher could create an inventory where there is a very high correlation between general happiness and contentment but if there is also a significant correlation between happiness and depression then the measure's construct validity is called into question
lines.name: English

lines.value: the test has convergent validity but not discriminant validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: lee cronbach and paul meehl 1955 proposed that the development of a nomological net was essential to measurement of a test's construct validity
lines.name: English

lines.value: a nomological network defines a construct by illustrating its relation to other constructs and behaviors
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a representation of the concepts constructs of interest in a study their observable manifestations and the interrelationship among them
lines.name: English

lines.value: it examines whether the relationships between similar construct are considered with relationships between the observed measures of the constructs
lines.name: English

lines.value: thorough observation of constructs relationships to each other it can generate new constructs
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example intelligence and working memory are considered highly related constructs
lines.name: English

lines.value: through the observation of their underlying components psychologists developed new theoretical constructs such as controlled attention and short term loading
lines.name: English

lines.value: creating a nomological net can also make the observation and measurement of existing constructs more efficient by pinpointing errors
lines.name: English

lines.value: researchers have found that studying the bumps on the human skull phrenology are not indicators of intelligence but volume of the brain is
lines.name: English

lines.value: removing the theory of phrenology from the nomological net of intelligence and adding the theory of brain mass evolution constructs of intelligence are made more efficient and more powerful
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weaving of all of these interrelated concepts and their observable traits creates a net that supports their theoretical concept
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example in the nomological network for academic achievement we would expect observable traits of academic achievement i.e gpa sat and act scores to relate to the observable traits for studiousness hours spent studying attentiveness in class detail of notes
lines.name: English

lines.value: if they do not then there is a problem with measurement of academic achievement or studiousness or with the purported theory of achievement
lines.name: English

lines.value: if they are indicators of one another then the nomological network and therefore the constructed theory of academic achievement is strengthened
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the nomological network proposed a theory of how to strengthen constructs it doesn't tell us how we can assess the construct validity in a study
lines.name: English

lines.value: the multitrait multimethod matrix mtmm is an approach to examining construct validity developed by campbell and fiske 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: this model examines convergence evidence that different measurement methods of a construct give similar results and discriminability ability to differentiate the construct from other related constructs
lines.name: English

lines.value: it measures six traits the evaluation of convergent validity the evaluation of discriminant divergent validity trait method units multitrait multimethods truly different methodologies and trait characteristics
lines.name: English

lines.value: this design allows investigators to test for convergence across different measures...of the same thing'...and for divergence between measures...of related but conceptually distinct things
lines.name: English

lines.value: apparent construct validity can be misleading due to a range of problems in hypothesis formulation and experimental design
lines.name: English

lines.value: chetnik ideology revolved around the notion of a greater serbia within the borders of yugoslavia to be created out of all territories in which serbs were found even if the numbers were small
lines.name: English

lines.value: a directive dated 20 december 1941 addressed to newly appointed commanders in montenegro major dordije lasic and captain pavle durisic outlined among other things the cleansing of all non serb elements in order to create a greater serbia the chetniks systemically massacred muslims in villages that they captured
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late autumn of 1941 the italians handed over the towns of visegrad gorazde foca and the surrounding areas in south east bosnia to the chetniks to run as a puppet administration and ndh forces were compelled by the italians to withdraw from there
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the chetniks gained control of gorazde on 29 november 1941 they began a massacre of home guard prisoners and ndh officials that became a systematic massacre of the local muslim civilian population
lines.name: English

lines.value: several hundred muslims were murdered and their bodies were left hanging in the town or thrown into the drina river
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 5 december 1941 the chetniks received the town of foca from the italians and proceeded to massacre around 500 muslims
lines.name: English

lines.value: additional massacres against the muslims in the area of foca took place in august 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: in total more than 2000 people were killed in foca
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early january chetniks entered srebrenica and killed around 1000 muslim civilians there and in nearby villages
lines.name: English

lines.value: around the same time the chetniks made their way to visegrad where deaths were reportedly in the thousands
lines.name: English

lines.value: massacres continued in the following months in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the village of zepa alone about three hundred were killed in late 1941
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early january chetniks massacred fifty four muslims in celebic and burned down the village
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 3 march chetniks burned forty two muslim villagers to death in drakan
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early january 1943 and again in early february montenegrin chetnik units were ordered to carry out cleansing actions against muslims first in the bijelo polje county in sandzak and then in february in the cajnice county and part of foca county in southeastern bosnia and in part of the pljevlja county in sandzak
lines.name: English

lines.value: pavle durisic the officer in charge of these operations reported to mihailovic chief of staff of the supreme command that on 10 january 1943 thirty three muslim villages had been burned down and 400 muslim fighters members of the muslim self protection militia supported by the italians and about 1000 women and children had been killed as against 14 chetnik dead and 26 wounded
lines.name: English

lines.value: in another report sent by durisic dated 13 february 1943 he reported that chetniks killed about 1200 muslim fighters and about 8000 old people women and children chetnik losses in the action were 22 killed and 32 wounded
lines.name: English

lines.value: he added that during the operation the total destruction of the muslim inhabitants was carried out regardless of sex and age
lines.name: English

lines.value: the total number of deaths caused by the anti muslim operations between january and february 1943 is estimated at 10000
lines.name: English

lines.value: the casualty rate would have been higher had a great number of muslims not already fled the area most to sarajevo when the february action began
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to a statement from the chetnik supreme command from 24 february 1943 these were countermeasures taken against muslim aggressive activities however all circumstances show that these massacres were committed in accordance with implementing the directive of 20 december 1941
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the khmer rouge killed many people due to their political affiliation education class origin occupation or ethnicity

lines.value: during the 1975 invasion and the subsequent occupation indonesian forces murdered tens of thousands of civilians

lines.value: this war has ravaged the country for over 30 years with several foreign actors playing important roles during different periods
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2001 us and nato troops have been fighting in afghanistan in the war on terror that is also treated in the corresponding section below
lines.name: English

lines.value: over 100000 civilians other than those killed in saddam's genocide are estimated to have been killed by both sides of the war by r.j.rummel

lines.value: the times reports november 26 2005 p 27
lines.name: English

lines.value: also see list of icty indictees for a variety of war criminals and crimes during this era

lines.value: from the times march 28 2006 p 43

lines.value: during the algerian civil war of the 1990s a variety of massacres occurred through the country many being identified as war crimes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the armed islamic group gia has avowed its responsibility for many of them while for others no group has claimed responsibility
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to generating a widespread sense of fear these massacres and the ensuing flight of population have resulted in serious depopulation of the worst affected areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the massacres peaked in 1997 with a smaller peak in 1994 and were particularly concentrated in the areas between algiers and oran with very few occurring in the east or in the sahara
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the first chechen war 1994-1996 and second chechen war 1999-2000 battle phase 2000 2009 insurgency phase there were many allegations of war crimes and terrorism against both sides from various human rights organizations
lines.name: English

lines.value: allegations of war crimes in the 2006 lebanon war refer to claims of various groups and individuals including amnesty international human rights watch and united nations officials who accused both hezbollah and israel of violating international humanitarian law during the 2006 lebanon war and warned of possible war crimes
lines.name: English

lines.value: these allegations included intentional attacks on civilian populations or infrastructure disproportionate or indiscriminate attacks in densely populated residential districts
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to various media reports between 1000 and 1200 lebanese citizens were reported dead there were between 1500 and 2500 people wounded and over 1000000 were temporarily displaced
lines.name: English

lines.value: over 150 israelis were killed 120 military thousands wounded and 300000-500000 were displaced because of hezbollah firing tens of thousands of rockets at major cities in israel
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the darfur conflict civil war in chad 2005-2010 the conflict in darfur has been variously characterised as a genocide
lines.name: English

lines.value: sudanese authorities claim a death toll of roughly 19500 civilians while many non governmental organizations such as the coalition for international justice claim over 400000 people have been killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2004 the world health organization estimated there had been 50000 deaths in darfur since the beginning of the conflict an 18-month period mostly due to starvation
lines.name: English

lines.value: an updated estimate the following month put the number of deaths for the 6-month period from march to october 2004 due to starvation and disease at 70000 these figures were criticised because they only considered short periods and did not include deaths from violence
lines.name: English

lines.value: a more recent british parliamentary report has estimated that over 300000 people have died and others have estimated even more
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were allegations of war crimes by both the israeli military and hamas
lines.name: English

lines.value: criticism of israel's conduct focused on the proportionality of its measures against hamas and on its alleged use of weaponised white phosphorus
lines.name: English

lines.value: numerous reports from human right groups during the war claimed that white phosphorus shells were being used by israel often in or near populated areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its early statements the israeli military denied using any form of white phosphorus saying we categorically deny the use of white phosphorus
lines.name: English

lines.value: it eventually admitted to its limited use and stopped using the shells including as a smoke screen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goldstone report investigating possible war crimes in the 2009 war accepted that white phosphorus is not illegal under international law but did find that the israelis were systematically reckless in determining its use in build up areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also called for serious consideration to be given to the banning of its use as an obscurant
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are allegations that war crimes were committed by the sri lankan military and the rebel liberation tigers of tamil eelam during the sri lankan civil war particularly during the final months of the conflict in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: the alleged war crimes include attacks on civilians and civilian buildings by both sides executions of combatants and prisoners by the government of sri lanka enforced disappearances by the sri lankan military and paramilitary groups backed by them acute shortages of food medicine and clean water for civilians trapped in the war zone and child recruitment by the tamil tigers
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is widely accused that the secretary of defense gotabaya rajapakse brother of president mahinda rajapaksa ordered troops under his command to kill them all when the troops on the grounds asked him for direction for handling the surrendering tamil combatants
lines.name: English

lines.value: a [[report of the secretary general's panel of experts on accountability in sri lanka|panel of experts]] appointed by un secretary general unsg ban ki moon to advise him on the issue of accountability with regard to any alleged violations of international human rights and humanitarian law during the final stages of the civil war found credible allegations which if proven indicated that war crimes and crimes against humanity were committed by the sri lankan military and the tamil tigers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the panel has called on the unsg to conduct an independent international inquiry into the alleged violations of international law
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sri lankan government has denied that its forces committed any war crimes and has strongly opposed any international investigation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has condemned the un report as fundamentally flawed in many respects and based on patently biased material which is presented without any verification
lines.name: English

lines.value: international organizations have accused the syrian government isil and other opposition forces of severe human rights violations with many massacres occurring

lines.value: chemical weapons have been used many times during the conflict as well

lines.value: the syrian government is reportedly responsible for the majority of civilian casualties and war crimes often through bombings
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition tens of thousands of protesters and activists have been imprisoned and there are reports of torture in state prisons
