lines.value: the outsiders are a fictional alien race in larry niven's known space series
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are many limbed beings that are invariably described as a cat o'nine tails with a fattened handle
lines.name: English

lines.value: their body composition includes ultra cold superfluid helium
lines.name: English

lines.value: outsiders are estimated to be the most advanced species in known space possibly the galaxy but the extent of their development remains unknown
lines.name: English

lines.value: though they have the technology to produce advanced faster than light drives they rarely use them preferring to travel the slow way just below the speed of light
lines.name: English

lines.value: they do possess a reactionless drive technology that allows them to reach this speed almost instantaneously
lines.name: English

lines.value: in ringworld's children louis wu says that the outsiders have something better than hyperdrive but this is not elaborated on
lines.name: English

lines.value: they spend all of their time following starseeds and acting as information brokers to space faring sentient races throughout the milky way
lines.name: English

lines.value: their prices can be very high and scaled to the estimated impact the information will have on the civilization of the client race
lines.name: English

lines.value: their most common wares are interstellar propulsion systems of various types
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outsiders maintain a strict commercial ethos regarding any form of knowledge which shrouds them in a secrecy only wealth can penetrate
lines.name: English

lines.value: they do not haggle
lines.name: English

lines.value: they will answer any question even those about themselves if you are willing to pay the price
lines.name: English

lines.value: personal questions about the outsiders have been priced beyond the ability of any individual or government to pay on the order of a trillion credits
lines.name: English

lines.value: in peace and freedom it is revealed that starseeds are in fact packages of microorganisms designed to seed new planets with life thus creating new customers for the outsiders
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are reluctant to reveal this information because they are ashamed since one of their starseeds created the thrint which destroyed nearly all intelligent life in the galaxy several billion years ago
lines.name: English

lines.value: another theory behind the outsiders starseed connection is that starseeds actually carry outsider spores as the outsiders are a small numbered species their offspring are of great importance to them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outsiders are thought to have evolved on a cold world with no atmosphere similar to neptune's moon nereid which they lease from the earth government
lines.name: English

lines.value: they live on thermoelectricity by lying with their heads in sunlight and their tails in shadow the temperature difference sets up a current
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some of the later known space stories it has been suggested that the outsiders do not use hyperspace as its conditions are lethal to them because they would be unable to generate thermoelectricity
lines.name: English

lines.value: outsider ships are equipped with an artificial sun for their journeys between systems but because of the nature of their ships the hyperspace blind spot would absorb this artificial light killing outsiders if they would remain in hyperspace too long
lines.name: English

lines.value: the canon of this material is debatable as it was not written by niven directly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the novel a darker geometry by gregory benford and mark o martin revealed that the outsiders were created by a race of extra dimensional aliens seeking to escape the heat death of their own universe
lines.name: English

lines.value: edward m lerner revealed in an online chat as eml that larry niven had ruled a darker geometry as definitely non canonical and incompatible with the then forthcoming juggler of worlds which was co authored by niven and lerner
lines.name: English

lines.value: juggler of worlds introduces a number of possible retcons to established outsider history
lines.name: English

lines.value: while in most of the known space series the name outsiders refers to the aforementioned species in stories that happen before the discovery of aliens the term outsider refers to any alien that might make contact with mankind
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outsiders may have inspired the melnorme from star control 2 another highly advanced and very mysterious species
lines.name: English

lines.value: the investor species in shaper/mechanist stories by bruce sterling have a similar ethos but an altogether different biology
lines.name: English

lines.value: mary wickes born mary isabella wickenhauser june 13 1910 - october 22 1995 was an american film and television character actress
lines.name: English

lines.value: she often played supporting roles as prim professional women secretaries nurses and housekeepers who made sarcastic quips when the leading characters fell short of her high standards
lines.name: English

lines.value: mary wickes was born to frank wickenhauser 1880-1943 and his wife mary isabella nee shannon died 1965 in st louis missouri of german scottish and irish extraction and raised protestant
lines.name: English

lines.value: her parents were theater buffs and took her to plays from the time that she could stay awake through a matinee
lines.name: English

lines.value: an excellent student she skipped two grades in grade school and graduated at sixteen from beaumont high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was accepted into washington university in st louis where she joined the debate team the phi mu women's fraternity and was initiated into mortar board in 1929
lines.name: English

lines.value: she graduated in 1930 with a double major in english literature and political science
lines.name: English

lines.value: although she had planned a career in law a favorite professor encouraged her to try drama and she shifted direction
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes first broadway appearance was in marc connelly's the farmer takes a wife in 1934 with henry fonda
lines.name: English

lines.value: she began acting in films in the late 1930s and was a member of the orson welles troupe on his radio drama the mercury theatre on the air she also appeared in welles film too much johnson 1938
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of her earliest significant film appearances was in the man who came to dinner 1942 reprising her stage role of nurse preen
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tall 5'10 gangling woman with a distinctive voice wickes would ultimately prove herself adept as a comedian
lines.name: English

lines.value: she attracted attention in now voyager 1942 as the wisecracking nurse who helped bette davis's character during her mother's illness
lines.name: English

lines.value: she had already appeared earlier that year with davis in the man who came to dinner and joined her again six years later in june bride
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1942 she also had a large part in the abbott and costello comedy who done it
lines.name: English

lines.value: she continued playing supporting roles in films during the next decade usually playing wisecracking characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: a prime example was her deadpan characterization of the harassed housekeeper in the doris day vehicles on moonlight bay and by the light of the silvery moon a character type she would repeat in the holiday classic white christmas 1954 starring bing crosby danny kaye rosemary clooney and vera ellen
lines.name: English

lines.value: she played similar roles in two later movies with rosalind russell in the 1960s the trouble with angels and where angels go trouble follows
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes moved to the new medium of television in 1949 starring in the title role of a westinghouse studio one version of mary poppins
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1950s wickes played the warm yet jocular maid katie in the mickey mouse club serial annette and regular roles in the sitcoms make room for daddy and dennis the menace
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also played the part of a ballet teacher madame lamond in the i love lucy episode the ballet 1952
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes also served as the live action reference model for cruella de vil in walt disney's one hundred and one dalmatians 1961 and played mrs squires in the film adaptation of meredith willson's the music man 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1953 wickes played the housekeeper martha to ezio pinza's character in nbc's short lived bonino sitcom
lines.name: English

lines.value: pinza portrayed an italian american opera singer trying to rear six children
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the child actors on the program were van dyke parks and chet allen
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1954-55 she played alice on the halls of ivy starring ronald colman
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1956 wickes appeared with thelma ritter in the babysitter episode of alfred hitchcock presents
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes also appeared in two episodes of zorro
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1961-62 season she appeared as maxfield opposite gertrude berg and cedric hardwicke in cbs's mrs g goes to college
lines.name: English

lines.value: for her work in the sitcom wickes was nominated for an emmy award for outstanding performance in a supporting role by an actress
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1964 she appeared on abc's the donna reed show in the episode first addition in 1964 she appeared as ida goff in five episodes of the nbc/warner brothers western series temple houston with jeffrey hunter as an historical figure the frontier lawyer temple lea houston youngest son of sam houston
lines.name: English

lines.value: a longtime friend of lucille ball wickes played frequent guest roles on i love lucy the lucy show and here's lucy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1970-1971 she guest starred on cbs's the doris day show day was another of her friends
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was also a regular on the sid and marty krofft children's television show sigmund and the sea monsters and the sitcom doc
lines.name: English

lines.value: she made numerous appearances as a celebrity panelist on the cbs game show match game
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the 1980s her appearances in television series such as our man higgins m*a*s*h the love boat and murder she wrote had made her a widely recognizable character actress
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also appeared in a variety of broadway shows including a 1979 revival of oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: as aunt eller for which she received rave reviews
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was cast as the mother of shirley maclaine's character in the film postcards from the edge 1990 and portrayed marie murkin in the television movie and series adaptations of father dowling mysteries 1989-91
lines.name: English

lines.value: she played sister mary lazarus in sister act 1992 and in the sequel sister act 2 back in the habit 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: she appeared in the film version of little women 1994 before she became ill
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes suffered from numerous ailments in the last years of her life including kidney failure massive gastrointestinal bleeding severe low blood pressure ischemic cardiomyopathy anemia and breast cancer stage of cancer unknown which cumulatively resulted in her death from surgical complications on october 22 1995 at age 85.her final film role voicing the gargoyle laverne in disney's animated feature the hunchback of notre dame was released posthumously in 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes had reportedly only one voice recording session left for the film when she died
lines.name: English

lines.value: jane withers came in to finish the character's remaining six lines of dialogue
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was interred beside her parents at the shiloh valley cemetery in shiloh illinois
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes was posthumously inducted into the st louis walk of fame in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: unmarried and without children wickes left a large estate and made a $2 million bequest in memory of her parents establishing the isabella and frank wickenhauser memorial library fund for television film and theater arts at washington university in st louis
lines.name: English

lines.value: wickes was a lifelong conservative minded republican
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau (; or , ) is the seat of salaj county transylvania romania
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 its estimated population was 56202
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau is situated in the area inhabited by free dacians away from the historical landmark of porolissum a well preserved roman castrum with an imposing fortress an amphitheater temples houses and a customs house in the ancient roman province of dacia
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau was the crossing point between central europe and transylvania along the so called salt route
lines.name: English

lines.value: archaeological discoveries revealed evidence of human existence in this area since the neolithic approx
lines.name: English

lines.value: 6500 years ago
lines.name: English

lines.value: dacian coins found in archaeological perimeters of the city central area and on the valea matii west of the city plus important items belonging to roman culture are evidence of free dacian continuity in this area and of developing economic relations with the roman ancient city of porolissum
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the conquest of dacia by trajan 106 the roman empire border stood atop the meses mountains just 5 km away from the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: just north from the border on the actual zalau city area were the free dacians tribes and to the east south east of meses mountains were roman border fortifications towers walls ditches and defense sides
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first written mention about zalau was in the gesta hungarorum also called the chronicle of anonymous probably notary of the king bela iii of hungary published around year 1200
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to this source zalau settlement would have been there as early as around 900
lines.name: English

lines.value: later zalau is referred to as villa ziloc in 1220 zylac in 1246 zylah in 1282 zyloh and oppidum zylah in 1318 zila in 1601 zilahu in 1808 szilaj szilagyi in 1839 szilaju in 1850 and zalau szilaju walthenberg in 1854
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the great mongol invasion which destroyed the city in 1241 zalau came in 1246 under the administration of the catholic bishopric of oradea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the trusteeship was maintained until 1542 when zalau became part of principality of transylvania
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 1 1473 matthias corvinus king of hungary and bohemia acknowledged zalau as a market town for the first time called oppidum zilah - zilah fort a privilege that freed the city from the county domination granted its citizens the right of free trade and gave it a larger degree of economic autonomy
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the 16th century the city had an independent administrative leadership composed of 33 elected senators one of whom was the mayor a notary a registrar and a treasurer
lines.name: English

lines.value: other important events in the development of the city occurred in 1571 during the reign of prince istvan bathory and in 1600 under the reign of michael the brave
lines.name: English

lines.value: after transylvania had been annexed to the habsburg empire the city experienced an economic decline due to infusion of products from the western europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: after michael the brave's victory in the battle of guruslau on august 3 1601 zalau received administrative legislative fiscal and military own rules which provided real autonomy freedoms to citizens
lines.name: English

lines.value: a chronicle from the 17th century first mentioned the main crafts of city residents belt makers potters wheelwrights shoemakers butchers tailors blacksmiths carpenters hat makers and armorers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city was under the rule principality of transylvania between 1526 1660
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also controlled by the ottomans between 1660 1692 the city being part of varat eyalet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the calvinist college was formed in the first half of the 17th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 9 november 1714 charles xii of sweden rested for a night in a building on kiraly street now named after corneliu coposu with an acquaintance gyorgy zovanyi as is indicated by a notice still on the house
lines.name: English

lines.value: until the administrative reform of 1876 the city had been the seat of kozep-szolnok for centuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: before the treaty of trianon zalau was one of the most important urban centers in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: it had a reformed college wesselenyi college a township school for civil service for boys only and a national civil school for girls only
lines.name: English

lines.value: it had the largest hospital in the region and a tax revenue office
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1850 its population was 4294 and in 1910 8062 7477 hungarians 19 germans 529 romanians and 23 belonging to other ethnic groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: by religion there were 1333 roman catholics 873 greek catholics 5363 members of the reformed church and 415 jews
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city had 1427 households and most of its inhabitants were working in manufacturing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the reformed church was built in 1246
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is one of the city's oldest buildings and one of the largest in eastern europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1876 zalau became the seat of the szilagy county
lines.name: English

lines.value: since union of transylvania with romania 1918 it has been part of romania - except between 1940 1944 when northern transylvania was under the hungarian rule after the second vienna award
lines.name: English

lines.value: when entered in zalau on september 8 1940 the hungarian army troops killed 11 persons just outside the city in ciumarna treznea massacre occurred in a nearby village in the next day
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1892 1896 one of the most famous hungarian poets endre ady attended the protestant school in zalau since 1957 there is a statue of endre ady in the front of the school
lines.name: English

lines.value: the poet also published his first poem in the local newspaper szilagy on march 22 1896
lines.name: English

lines.value: a memorial plaque on the frontage of the building where he lived reminds of ady endre's time spent here
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the 19th century lajos szikszai donated his private collection to the municipality and the first museum in zalau was created
lines.name: English

lines.value: an exhibition was also organized in 1926 but the zalau county museum was officially inaugurated in 1951
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 9 1981 a new section of the zalau county museum was inaugurated and was named the ioan sima arts gallery
lines.name: English

lines.value: the central library owning 7000 romanian and hungarian books was opened on the 23 the august 1950
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1952 it became district library coordinating all the zalau district libraries
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1957 it took the name of ionita scipione badescu
lines.name: English

lines.value: it became the county library with the administrative reform of february 1968
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was after the 1960s when the city became a regional industrial center for the first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the communist regime industrial factories like armatura zalau silcotub zalau and anvelope silvania bought recently by michelin hired thousands of workers which also sparked an increase in population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the romanian communist regime saw that thousands of romanians from the south were brought and established into the region in an effort to uproot and outnumber the hungarian majority population - this was in effect a form of ethnic cleansing and had the desired result the hungarian romanian population ratio is nowadays completely changed from what it used to be in the past with the romanians being now the majority and the hungarians reduced to the minority
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the surrounding countryside this artificial romanianization has failed
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the surrounding communes for example varsolt are still populated in majority by hungarians on the other hand nearby villages such as marin have a 100% ethnic romanian population basically unchanged for more than a century
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the same for vast parts of transylvania and it is the same for the old german populations which were also effectively pushed out of the country by the communists in the recent decades
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1970s with the working class population expanding housing estates of high rise blocks of flats were built in the centre as well as on the outskirts of the town
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of inappropriate infrastructure development a such block of flats exploded in 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: today zalau is crossed by european road e81 and the national road dn 1f
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new motorway transylvania highway is being built to connect zalau to western europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the town has two nationally accredited university colleges a public library one museum an art gallery more than four hotels a motel and two student halls of residence
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau lies in the zalau valley at the junction of the apuseni mountains and the eastern carpathians in salaj county at
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau is in the central part of salaj county in zalau river watershed where the depression of the same name and the meses peak meet
lines.name: English

lines.value: it neighbours tara maramuresului and the county of satu mare in the northwestern part of the historical region of transylvania which in the past was a mainly independent small state but since 1918 has belonged to romania
lines.name: English

lines.value: it lies along the bank of the small zalau river between three narrow valleys in the meses mountains
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the county seat and the largest city in salaj county
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city includes a total surface of
lines.name: English

lines.value: this includes the one village it administers stana felsonyarlo situated south east of meses in the hydrographic basin of agrij
lines.name: English

lines.value: magura stanii has
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most important of the 24 monuments and buildings in the county capital of zalau are transilvania theatre in 1895 the city hall court and seat of the prefects office in 1889 the roman catholic church 1878 the reformed church 1904-1907 the greek catholic church adormirea maicii domnului 1930-1934 the orthodox deanery built in the late 19th century the historical museum built about 1900 - casino of the artisans fellowship the primary school simion barnutiu girls school in 1895 and the national college silvania reformed college in 1860 all these being valuable urbanistic elements for the historical and cultural patrimony of the land
lines.name: English

lines.value: the famous statuary group wesselenyi monument of the heroic hungarian nobleman with the same name 1902 by janos fadrusz and the bust made in the honour of simion barnutiu by romul ladea are worth visiting as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: zalau hosts lively pageants each year including a summer festival known as the zalau days
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a statue of baron wesselenyi in iuliu maniu square of the town center the tuhutum memorial both made by janos fadrusz in 1902 the zalau county museum of history and art displays artifacts ranging from neolithic times to modern times with a focus on the roman period and hosts works of modern art
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are several churches including the calvinist cathedral which is one of the most beautiful and largest in transylvania

lines.value: the first uss thomas dd-182 was a in the united states navy following world war i she was later transferred to the royal navy as hms st albans i15 as a but spent most of the war in the exiled royal norwegian navy before transferred to the soviet navy as dostoyny
lines.name: English

lines.value: named after clarence crase thomas she was laid down on 23 march 1918 at newport news virginia by the newport news shipbuilding and dry dock company launched on 4 july 1918 sponsored by mrs evelyn m thomas widow of lieutenant thomas and commissioned on 25 april 1919 lieutenant commander harry a mcclure in command
lines.name: English

lines.value: thomas operated off the east coast on training cruises and exercises until decommissioned at philadelphia on 30 june 1922
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this service she was classified dd 182 during the navy wide assignment of alphanumeric hull numbers on 17 july 1920
lines.name: English

lines.value: she lay in reserve in the philadelphia navy yard's back channel for the next 18 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: recommissioned on 17 june 1940 - as the united states navy expanded to meet the demands imposed by neutrality patrols off american coastlines - thomas was assigned to destroyer division 79 of the atlantic squadron and operated briefly in training and exercises off the eastern seaboard until transferred to the united kingdom under the destroyer for bases agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: she arrived at halifax nova scotia on 18 september 1940 as part of the second increment of the 50 flush decked four piped destroyers exchanged with the british for leases on strategic base sites in the western hemisphere
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a brief familiarization period for the royal navy bluejackets assigned to the ship thomas was officially turned over to her new owners on 23 september 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: her name was subsequently struck from the united states navy list on 8 january 1941
lines.name: English

lines.value: simultaneously renamed hms st albans i15 and commissioned the same day for service in the royal navy the destroyer sailed for the british isles on 29 september
lines.name: English

lines.value: after calling at st john's newfoundland en route she arrived at belfast northern ireland on 9 october
lines.name: English

lines.value: st albans and three sister ships - hms st mary's hms bath and hms charlestown - were attached to the 1st minelaying squadron as permanent escort force
lines.name: English

lines.value: operating off the west coast of scotland the destroyers participated in some of the earliest minelaying operations in the denmark strait which separates iceland from greenland
lines.name: English

lines.value: between minecraft escort missions st albans escorted convoys
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 17 and 18 january 1941 the destroyer searched for survivors from torpedoed by on 17 january
lines.name: English

lines.value: st albans underwent repairs at chatham in february to prepare for her transfer to the royal norwegian navy in exile on 14 april
lines.name: English

lines.value: st albans had no sooner entered service with the norwegians than she collided with the minesweeping trawler hms alberic sinking the trawler and sustaining enough damage herself to necessitate repairs in the dockyard
lines.name: English

lines.value: when again ready for action st albans joined the 7th escort group operating out of liverpool
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 12 june she picked up the survivors from the sunken steamship - torpedoed that day by the - and brought them safely to liverpool
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 3 august 1941 while bound from sierra leone to the united kingdom in the screen of convoy sl 81 st albans joined the destroyer and the in sinking
lines.name: English

lines.value: during subsequent operations screening convoys in shipping lanes between west africa and the british isles st albans made a score of attacks on u boats but could not repeat her kill performance of 3 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the following autumn a heavy gale severely damaged st albans while she was escorting convoy on 22 on 8 october
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following day brought little respite from the high seas and strong winds but st albanss norwegian sailors brought her safely into reykjavik iceland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the destroyer's seaworthiness and the seamanship exhibited by her norwegian crew elicited a warm commendatory signal from the commander in chief western approaches c-in-c wa
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this message of 12 october 1941 he also praised the destroyer's exemplary steaming performance during the previous three months
lines.name: English

lines.value: st albans meanwhile continued her escort duties with the 7th escort group into 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march she escorted the damaged aircraft carrier from liverpool to the clyde and in the following month helped to screen convoy pq 15 as it carried arms to russia
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the operation heavy german air and submarine attacks took a toll of three allied ships
lines.name: English

lines.value: in wartime however mistakes in identification or errors in navigation sometimes lead to disaster
lines.name: English

lines.value: on one occasion these factors combined with tragic results when st albans and the minesweeper sank the polish submarine on 2 may
lines.name: English

lines.value: five crewmen were killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: a court of enquiry found that jastrzab was 100 miles out of position in an area where u boats were expected to operate and no blame could be attached to either commander
lines.name: English

lines.value: however this conclusion is disputed by other sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: later that month the flush decked destroyer joined the liverpool special escort division
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the vessels escorted early in june was the cunard white star liner as the cunarder steamed from the british isles toward the cape of good hope with troops bound for the middle east
lines.name: English

lines.value: then after refitting at falmouth between july and october 1942 st albans again operated with the special escort division until the end of 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1943 she served as a target vessel for training raf coastal command aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: late in february she got underway and steamed into the north sea toward the scandinavian coast to search for a norwegian merchantman which was reportedly attempting to escape to sea from german controlled waters
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this mission the destroyer was attacked by german aircraft but emerged unharmed
lines.name: English

lines.value: shifted to the western local escort force soon thereafter st albans was based at halifax and operated in convoy escort missions in the western atlantic for the remainder of 1943
lines.name: English

lines.value: departing halifax four days after christmas 1943 st albans arrived in the tyne on 10 january 1944 where she was soon laid up in reserve
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 16 july 1944 the british transferred st albans to the soviet navy who renamed her dostoyny rus

lines.value: padang ( jawi ) is the capital of the province of west sumatra in indonesia
lines.name: English

lines.value: with an area of 695 km and a population of 1000096 in 2014 it is the 16th-most populated city in indonesia the most populated city on sumatra's western coast and fifth most populated city on sumatra
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city had historically been a trading center since the precolonial era trading in pepper and gold
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dutch made contact with the city in the mid 17th century eventually constructing a fortress and taking over control of the city from the pagaruyung kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: save several interruptions of british rule padang remained part of the dutch east indies as one of its major cities until indonesian independence
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang has been a trade centre since the 16th century having been controlled by the pagaruyung kingdom and the aceh sultanate
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 16th and 17th centuries pepper was cultivated and traded with india portugal the united kingdom and the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1663 the city came under the authority of the dutch and a trading post was built in 1680
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city came under the british empire twice firstly from 1781 to 1784 during the fourth anglo dutch war and again from 1795 to 1819 during the napoleonic wars
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1819 the city was transferred back to the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: up to circa 1780 the most important trade product was gold originating from gold mines in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the mines were exhausted the focus turned to other products such as coffee salts and textiles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1797 padang was inundated by a tsunami with an estimated flow depth of 5 10 meters following an earthquake estimated to be 8.5-8.7 m w which occurred off the coast
lines.name: English

lines.value: the shaking caused considerable damage and the deaths of two people while the tsunami resulted in several houses being washed away and several deaths at the village of air manis
lines.name: English

lines.value: boats moored in the arau river ended up on dry land including a 200-ton sailing ship which was deposited about 1 kilometre upstream
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1833 another tsunami inundated padang with an estimated flow depth of 3 4 meters as a result of an earthquake estimated to be 8.6-8.9 m w which occurred off bengkulu
lines.name: English

lines.value: the shaking caused considerable damage in padang and due to the tsunami boats moored in the arau river broke their anchors and were scattered
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population of padang in 1920 was 28754 the second largest city in sumatra behind palembang
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of independence in the 1940s the city had around 50000 inhabitants
lines.name: English

lines.value: coffee was still important but copra was also a major item produced by farmers in its hinterland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the population growth since then has been partly a result of growth in the area of the city but largely is a result of the migration to major cities seen in so many developing nations
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1950 the ombilin coal field developed with padang as its outlet port
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was seen by some observers as reflecting the economic and political colonisation of indonesia
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 30 september 2009 a 7.9 magnitude earthquake hit about 50 kilometres off the coast of padang
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were more than 1100 fatalities 313 of which occurred within padang
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang is exactly at the antipodes of esmeraldas ecuador
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang features a tropical rainforest climate under koppen's climate classification
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang is one of indonesia's wettest cities with frequent rainfall throughout the course of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city averages roughly 4300 mm of rain per year
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang's driest month is february where 250 mm of precipitation on average is observed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city temperatures are relatively constant throughout the year with an average of 26 degrees celsius
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 2007 the city government began a number of religiously motivated policies
lines.name: English

lines.value: one requires females of all religious backgrounds who are municipal employees and students in government schools to wear jilbab hijab and high school students now take classes on reading the qur'an
lines.name: English

lines.value: municipal employees are required to pay zakat
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city of padang is divided into 11 districts kecamatan
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2017 padang had received the adipura cleanest and greenest city award in the category of large city 18 times and the adipura kencana award three times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cuisine of the minangkabau people is commonly called padang cuisine
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang restaurants are common throughout the country and are famous for their spicy food
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang food is usually cooked once per day and all customers choose from those dishes which are left out on display until no food is left
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is served in small portions of various dishes but constituting with rice a complete meal
lines.name: English

lines.value: customers take - and pay for - only what they want from this array of dishes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the best known padang dish is rendang a spicy meat stew
lines.name: English

lines.value: soto padang crispy beef in spicy soup is local residents breakfast favourite meanwhile sate beef satay in curry sauce served with ketupat is a treat in the evening
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang is a common transit point for surfers travelling to batu islands and mentawai islands and for tourists visiting the west sumatran highlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang beach known as taplau or tapi lauik which located from samudra street until puruih is well known for its beautiful sunset and hundreds of food stalls
lines.name: English

lines.value: kuranji river flows in padang and on top area of the river at batu busuk lambung bukit sub district is suitable for white water activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: bungus bay to the south of padang is suitable for swimming and boating
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are some pleasant offshore islands near bungus such as sikuai island and pagang island
lines.name: English

lines.value: many beautiful spots which can be visited for snorkelling fishing or just relaxing on the white sandy beaches
lines.name: English

lines.value: currently regional development planning board bappeda of padang has established development plans padang old city in kampung pondok south padang district as a tourist area
lines.name: English

lines.value: mayor of padang has been designate 73 historic buildings as cultural heritage of padang
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are many old buildings in padang that still retain their dutch and chinese architecture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the old city of padang located next to muaro harbor at arau river which formerly functioned as the city's main commercial avenue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the old city was the former business district of padang there are many important buildings such as padang city hall de javaschebank present-day bank indonesia nederlandsch spaarbank geo wehry & co escompto maatschappij office warehouses and merchant houses
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are several historic places such as adityawarman museum which specialises in the history and culture of the local minangkabau ethnic group and the main exhibits are housed within a rumah gadang style building
lines.name: English

lines.value: grand mosque of west sumatra a new modern large mosque that is built with minangkabau architecture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mosque is located on jalan khatib sulaiman city centre of padang
lines.name: English

lines.value: ganting grand mosque the oldest mosque in padang and one of the oldest in indonesia is a popular tourist attraction
lines.name: English

lines.value: muhammadan mosque founded by indian merchant is also located in the city centre
lines.name: English

lines.value: st leo monastery features a mixture of traditional minang architecture on its bell tower roofing and dutch architecture on the church building is one of the oldest churches in padang
lines.name: English

lines.value: along the beachside road just down from the tourist information office is a buddhist temple vihara buddha warman opened in 2006 for the large chinese buddhist community
lines.name: English

lines.value: air manis beach sweet water beach is located 10 km south of padang location of the legendary malin kundang stone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rock formations are found which resemble ship wrecks
lines.name: English

lines.value: across from the arau river is the siti nurbaya park which can reached by bridge or boat
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are still remains of japanese cannons and bunkers from world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are great views of padang city arau river and the indian ocean
lines.name: English

lines.value: bung hatta nature reserve taman hutan raya bung hatta is situated 18 km east of the city with diverse flora and fauna including a few sumatran tigers tapirs wild goats bears as well as raflesia gaduansi balangphora and amorphopalus
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang also has some modern malls the most popular malls are transmart basko grand mall spr plaza plaza andalas and rocky plaza
lines.name: English

lines.value: the upcoming malls in the city are padang landmark mall and padang green city
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang is the home town of the soccer team semen padang with haji agus salim stadium being the home stadium of the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang is home to an annual international dragon boat competition
lines.name: English

lines.value: the transpadang bus rapid transit service was developed used jakarta's transjakarta system as a model but without a dedicated lane and comfortable shelters
lines.name: English

lines.value: today trans padang runs only from lubuk buaya to pasar raya a distance of 18 km with a fleet of 10 large buses capacity 60 and 15 medium buses capacity 40
lines.name: English

lines.value: daily passengers number 7000 in corridor 1 an increase from the initial ridership of 4000
lines.name: English

lines.value: the load factor is 128% in the morning and evening rush hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city is served by the newly opened minangkabau international airport in ketaping padang pariaman
lines.name: English

lines.value: it replaces the old tabing airport which is currently used as a military base
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is one terminal building for both international and domestic flights
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport has 4 aerobridges 17 check in counters 5 baggage conveyors and 9 ticket sales counters
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late 2013 the runway was lengthened by 250 m so that it could accommodate boeing 747 and airbus a340 planes and there is also a plan to connect the airport to the city of padang with a train service
lines.name: English

lines.value: a terminal expansion phase ii has been announced with the rendering already released on the angkasa pura 2 website
lines.name: English

lines.value: padang's teluk bayur harbour the former emmahaven port is the largest and busiest harbour on the west coast of sumatra
lines.name: English

lines.value: it serves inter island as well as international routes
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was built in 1888 by the colonial government of the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 29 april 2013 a new container terminal was officially opened by west sumatra governor which can hold more than 4000 containers in 46886 square meter area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the port is the main gateway to the mentawai islands including siberut sipora and south pagai
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also ferry connections between padang to jakarta and sibolga next to gunung sitoli nias
lines.name: English

lines.value: west sumatra administration has secured lands for the construction of a 27-kilometer toll road between padang and sicincin district with about rp.1.3 trillion $141.7 million investment
lines.name: English

lines.value: 80 percent of the land with a width of 30 meters has been acquired but they will acquire more land to meet an ideal width of 50 meters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the construction project will be initialised in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: railroad tracks connect padang to pariaman to the north padangpanjang to the northeast solok and sawahlunto to the east
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest train station is padang station known as simpang haru station
lines.name: English

lines.value: sibinuang and dang tuanku provides the trip services from padang simpang haru to pariaman vice versa
lines.name: English

lines.value: government and the people of hill pangilun has agreed to make mount pangilun as tsunami shelter

lines.value: better road access to the hill will be built as well as temporary shelters including their facilities

lines.value: samarskite is a radioactive rare earth mineral series which includes samarskite-(y with formula yfe 3+ fe 2+ u,th,ca 2 nb,ta 2 o 8 and samarskite-(yb with formula ybfe 3+ ) 2 nb,ta 2 o 8
lines.name: English

lines.value: the formula for samarskite-(y is also given as y,fe 3+ ,u)(nb,ta)o 4
lines.name: English

lines.value: samarskite crystallizes in the orthorhombic dipyramidal class as black to yellowish brown stubby prisms although it is typically found as anhedral masses
lines.name: English

lines.value: specimens with a high uranium content are typically metamict and appear coated with a yellow brown earthy rind
lines.name: English

lines.value: samarskite occurs in rare earth bearing granite pegmatites with other rare minerals
lines.name: English

lines.value: it occurs in association with columbite zircon monazite uraninite aeschynite magnetite albite topaz beryl garnet muscovite and biotite
lines.name: English

lines.value: samarskite was first described in 1847 for an occurrence in miass ilmen mountains southern ural mountains of russia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chemical element samarium was first isolated from a specimen of samarskite in 1879
lines.name: English

lines.value: samarium was named after samarskite which was named for the russian mine official colonel vasili samarsky bykhovets 1803-1870
lines.name: English

lines.value: samarskite-(yb was first described in 2004 for an occurrence in the south platte pegmatite district jefferson county colorado

lines.value: david joseph mitchell born march 15 1954 is a canadian writer former politician university and college administrator businessman and political commentator
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a former president & ceo of the public policy forum an ottawa based ngo which he abruptly left on august 20 2015
lines.name: English

lines.value: his current position is vice president college advancement and chief external relations officer at bow valley college in calgary alberta
lines.name: English

lines.value: mitchell holds a master's degree in canadian and american history from simon fraser university in burnaby british columbia
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as editor and archivist at the british columbia provincial archives
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a self confessed political junkie who is a frequent commentator on canadian politics and public life on radio and television
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has won awards for his writing and is a former newspaper columnist vancouver sun 1996 98 business in vancouver 1995 98
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has authored a number of books about politics and history in bc
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is the father of two daughters and is married to author and women's advocate shari graydon
lines.name: English

lines.value: mitchell has also worked as an executive in the forestry industry and in resource industries in western canada 1984-1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: he gained experience in parliamentary procedure and legislative processes as deputy clerk of the saskatchewan legislature 1981-84
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was elected in 1991 to the legislative assembly of british columbia for the liberal party in the riding of west vancouver garibaldi
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the party's house leader but resigned his position as a result of a rift over the charlottetown constitutional accord
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sat the remainder of his term until 1996 as an independent
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his term he was a on a broad range of issues including resource management labour relations advanced education and parliamentary reform
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as vice president of external relations at simon fraser university from 1997 to 2002 where he was responsible for fundraising alumni relations media and public relations and government affairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: sfu raised over $65 million under his direction and significantly expanded its campus in downtown vancouver
lines.name: English

lines.value: he became vice president of university relations at the university of ottawa in september 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: he led the university through a major rebranding initiative and helped launch the largest fundraising campaign in the university's history which exceeded its $200 million objective a year ahead of schedule
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2007 he moved to queen's university assuming the post of vice principal advancement
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2009 he returned to ottawa to take a new position as president and ceo of the public policy forum an independent non partisan ngo that specializes in convening canadian leaders on issues of public service and governance
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2016 he commenced his new role at bow valley college as vice president college advancement and chief external relations officer
lines.name: English

lines.value: mitchell has served on the boards of the vancouver art gallery vancouver aquarium and marine science centre the ottawa symphony the great canadian theatre company the parliamentary centre and on the advisory committee of the centre for the study of democracy at queen's university
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a governor and fellow of the royal canadian geographical society
lines.name: English

lines.value: tuva is a part of russia inhabited by a turkic people related to the nearby mongolians
lines.name: English

lines.value: tuvans are known abroad for khoomei xoomej a kind of overtone singing
lines.name: English

lines.value: traditionally music from tuva was only a solo effort
lines.name: English

lines.value: the musician's intention was usually to emphasize timbre and harmonics over rhythm
lines.name: English

lines.value: the performances were often in places of natural acoustics such as caves cliffs rivers and so on
lines.name: English

lines.value: the performer would often take long pauses to allow nature its own chance to converse back
lines.name: English

lines.value: the modern music found today is often composed of ensembles of musicians playing multiple instruments and often is much more pulsatile than its traditional uses
lines.name: English

lines.value: tuvans belief in spirits is apparent in their musical practices
lines.name: English

lines.value: praise songs and chants called algysh and the rhythmically chanted poetic couplets that precede breaths of throat singing address cher eezi or local spirit masters with words
lines.name: English

lines.value: throat singing is instead made to imitate sounds produced by the places or beings in which the spirit masters dwell
lines.name: English

lines.value: singers establish contact with the spirit master by reproducing the sounds made and enter into conversation whose aim is supplication an expression of gratitude or an appeal for protection
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same imitative or mimetic interaction with the natural sound world may also be meditated through the use of traditional musical instruments
lines.name: English

lines.value: calm mimetic singing in reproduction of the sounds of a certain place is believed to be the best possible offering to spirit masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: this region is also famous for its indigenous shaman population
lines.name: English

lines.value: shamans commonly created music in order to call upon spirits conjure ancestors discover birthplaces connect with natural surroundings and to attract spirits for hunters
lines.name: English

lines.value: shamans were not the only people to practice this type of communion between nature and song
lines.name: English

lines.value: shepherds would also play music to herd animals and imitate galloping horses
lines.name: English

lines.value: each song had a certain meaning according to where the musician was and whether or not the situation was work or relaxation
lines.name: English

lines.value: early tuva created sounds that don't fit in with western musical theory but instead stand alone existing for a certain way of being
lines.name: English

lines.value: many traditional tuvan songs share the same structure
lines.name: English

lines.value: they may consist of several verses each four lines long and each line having eight syllables
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is not uncommon for all lines in a verse to begin with a word starting with the same letter or a similar sounding letter
lines.name: English

lines.value: in parallel with traditional music since the 1970s also modern genres of music developed in tuva mainly pop and rock music as well as fusion of these genres with khoomei
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most popular tuvan musical group is huun huur tu
lines.name: English

lines.value: notable tuvan rock and fusion performers include yat kha as well as all deceased alexander sarzhat ool guitar who spent 22 years in jail before starting the music career and was self taught alexander chavynchak guitar who performed free jazz and blues as well as khoomei and vladimir oidupaa bayan and khoomei
lines.name: English

lines.value: is a japanese animator who worked with toei animation and studio ghibli
lines.name: English

lines.value: otsuka was born in shimane prefecture
lines.name: English

lines.value: during a visit to tsuwano at the age of 10 he saw a steam locomotive for the first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: he began to take an interest in locomotives and their operation and would frequently sketch them
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1945 his family moved to yamaguchi prefecture where there was a military base
lines.name: English

lines.value: he began to draw the array of military vehicles located there while also drawing a variety of subjects in different styles
lines.name: English

lines.value: otsuka also collected cuttings of cartoon strips into scrapbooks to learn more about drawing styles
lines.name: English

lines.value: otsuka later joined the yamaguchi's beurau of statistics but wanted to become a political cartoonist in tokyo
lines.name: English

lines.value: however at the time permission was needed to move to tokyo so he applied to the health and welfare ministry
lines.name: English

lines.value: after passing the exam he was assigned to the drug enforcement division as an assistant who maintained the firearms of the agents
lines.name: English

lines.value: around this time he suffered from tuberculosis
lines.name: English

lines.value: during 1956 otsuka saw an advertisement in yomiuri shinbun where toei were asking for applications for animators
lines.name: English

lines.value: after passing the test otsuka worked with yasuji mori and akira daikubara on the tale of the white serpent and learnt their approaches
lines.name: English

lines.value: wanting to learn more animation theory he began to seek out textbooks and was shown a textbook on us animation written by preston blair
lines.name: English

lines.value: after working on magic boy film in 1959 his animation of a skeleton was unintentionally considered comical due to its realism
lines.name: English

lines.value: this led to comical bad guy characters becoming otsuka's speciality
lines.name: English

lines.value: he came to believe that genuine realism doesn't suit animation and constructed realism is more suitable
lines.name: English

lines.value: hayao miyazaki compared otsuka to kenichi enomoto in the use of this approach
lines.name: English

lines.value: after completion of his next film the wonderful world of puss n boots otsuka left toei to join a production
lines.name: English

lines.value: otsuka has written several books about the anime industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: his is considered a prime resource for the history of 1960s and 1970s anime
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 2002 a exhibition of his work and personal pieces was held in ginza
lines.name: English

lines.value: otsuka is currently an advisor to telecom animation film
lines.name: English

lines.value: * opening title
lines.name: English

lines.value: * conversation between otsuka yasuo and sadamoto yoshiyuki
