lines.value: the way international is a nontrinitarian biblical research teaching and fellowship christian ministry based in new knoxville ohio with home fellowships located internationally including argentina the democratic republic of congo chile and the uk
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was founded by victor paul wierwille in 1942 as a radio program subsequently becoming the chimes hour youth caravan in 1947 and the way inc in 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ministry distributes publications such as the way magazine through its company american christian press and has developed and promotes classes and other programs some of which are in several languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: it formed the way corps a leadership training program in 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way offers classes in biblical studies to its followers prominently the way of abundance and power class series
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international claims to study first century christianity
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has been described as combining biblical literalism evangelicalism calvinism ultradispensationalism and pentecostalism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the teaching of the way is based on that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation
lines.name: English

lines.value: its founder's and subsequent way interpretations of the bible are taught in ministry classes and publications
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international fellowships are located throughout the united states as well as over 30 countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: it reported $527.1 million in income for fiscal year 1984
lines.name: English

lines.value: by some estimates by 1980 100000 people had undertaken its power for abundant living pfal course and by 1983 it reported membership of 2657 twigs an organizational term each ideally consisting of 10 members
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way is predominantly financed via its course fees and tithing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way has faced criticism for some of its beliefs and policies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 the president of the way craig martindale resigned following allegations of sexual misconduct
lines.name: English

lines.value: rev rosalie f rivenbark became president of the organization and served along with two other members on its board of directors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2017 rev jean yves delisle was installed as the fourth president of the way and currently serves in this position
lines.name: English

lines.value: victor paul wierwille known by his followers as doctor was born in his family farm's kitchen on november 30 1916 occasionally attributed as december 31
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had a great interest in christianity since his youth
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended mission house college and seminary moody bible institute and the university of chicago divinity school
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later received a master of theology degree from princeton theological seminary and an unaccredited doctorate from pike's peak bible seminary
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was ordained as a minister in the evangelical and reformed church now united church of christ
lines.name: English

lines.value: he maintained he had recovered the true apostolic understanding of christianity which had been lost to the church
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later claimed god spoke to him personally telling him he would teach him the word as it had not been known since the first century so that he could pass it on to others
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 3 1942 victor paul wierwille an evangelical and reformed church pastor began a weekly live radio program dubbed vesper chimes
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille assembled a group of youth to help him from local churches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the program was broadcast from wlok in lima ohio where the youth would sing and perform alongside wierwille's sermons that included principles for abundant life
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon afterwards the program was renamed the chimes hour youth caravan
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille published his first book victory through christ in 1945 compiling his radio sermons
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1947 the chimes hour youth caravan incorporated with wierwille as president alongside a board of directors
lines.name: English

lines.value: that year the way the chimes hour young people's publication began publishing writings by people associated with the radio program each month
lines.name: English

lines.value: starting in 1948 wierwille began broadcasting every morning in addition to the regular weekly program
lines.name: English

lines.value: nearly ten years following the first broadcast the van wert gospel gift shop and multigraph printing and publishing co opened for business and released the first issue of the way magazine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chimes hour youth caravan continued to have radio and public performances until april 1953 at which time the nielsen ratings showed that 70000 homes were tuned in on sundays broadcasting over radio station wlw cincinnati
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille continued to broadcast his meditations over wima formerly wlok lima wonw defiance and wrfd worthington ohio until 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1953 wierwille started teaching the course that would later become power for abundant living or the way's standard training course
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was held in van wert ohio
lines.name: English

lines.value: it expanded to other locations in ohio and eventually to other states
lines.name: English

lines.value: four years later he resigned from the evangelical and reformed church pastorate to devote his time to the way ministry
lines.name: English

lines.value: moving to his family's farm in new knoxville in 1959 he established the location as the headquarters for the way's institute for biblical research and teaching later the way inc the way's followers grew significantly in the late 1960s and early 1970s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1968 wierwille's visited san francisco to personally witness the jesus people street ministries such as those in haight ashbury where he ministered himself
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the groups he met later incorporated as the way east based in rye new york and the way west based in mill valley california groups that utilized wierwille's pfal class in their ministries
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille also recruited a number of new members on his trip marking a period of large growth for his ministry
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille later merged the way east and the way west into the way inc now the way international
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1982 during the ministry's 40th anniversary celebration wierwille installed l craig martindale as president and accepted the title founding president
lines.name: English

lines.value: martindale became involved with the way in 1971 while a university of kansas student and fellowship of christian athletes member
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as director of the way corps from 1974 to 2000 retaining the position after becoming president
lines.name: English

lines.value: an elaborate public ceremony signified martindale's installation as president which included a symbolic passing of a mantle representing the authority transferring from wierwille to martindale
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 martindale's term as president was ended following the admittance of sexual misconduct and rev rosalie f rivenbark replaced him
lines.name: English

lines.value: the governing board originally called the board of trustees is now called the board of directors consisting of three to five directors with rivenbark as chairman of the board
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2017 rev rivenbark stepped down from the presidency but retained her position as chairman of the board of directors
lines.name: English

lines.value: rev jean yves delisle was installed as the fourth president
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international headquarters is located in new knoxville ohio and presently they also own and operate camp gunnison the way household ranch in gunnison colorado
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way is organized into regions states and branches located internationally with each branch consisting of two or more household fellowships
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way focuses on these fellowships as a basic organizational unit
lines.name: English

lines.value: meetings are run in each home by fellowship coordinators who have completed the way of abundance and power class series
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international claims no official membership other than the board of directors individuals who participate in fellowships are referred to as followers of the way or believers
lines.name: English

lines.value: until at least the late 1980s the way's organization was based on a tree with leaves individual believers twigs small group fellowships of about 6 to 12 persons usually private homes or college bible groups branches groups of two or more fellowships in a local area such as a city limbs state organizations regions groupings of several limbs and the international headquarters in new knoxville being the trunk
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way offers three sequential classes covering bible studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the foundational and intermediate classes are required prior to taking any other classes
lines.name: English

lines.value: to qualify for the advanced class which is held specially in ohio each summer a student must first complete the foundational and intermediate classes twice in addition to defeating the adversary
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1970 wierwille formalized his selection and training of ministry leaders by starting the way corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way corps motto is it is written
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the first corps wierwille invited a group of way followers to new knoxville for training and teaching
lines.name: English

lines.value: he disbanded the group for reasons which were never made public other than a statement in the way living in love that they never got it together among themselves and that wierwille gave them the privilege of leaving
lines.name: English

lines.value: this group was later referred to as the zero corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1977 the way purchased property in rome city indiana where the family corps those adults who wanted to train as leaders but had children or were older over 40 resided and trained
lines.name: English

lines.value: a working farm rome city was purchased from the catholic church
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1974 the way purchased the former site of a united presbyterian college in emporia kansas with an opening enrolment of 400 students
lines.name: English

lines.value: activities during the campus residencies included basic mandatory physical activity jogging and other optional activities as desired weightlifting team sports etc
lines.name: English

lines.value: days were spent on work assignments usually involving the needs of each campus such as painting food service construction building renovation sanitation gardening
lines.name: English

lines.value: other programs included biblical research and study nights led by ministry staff and typically involved in depth study of various books of the bible
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the work projects of the emporia campus formerly the college of emporia was the restoration of the anderson memorial library a carnegie library that was built in 1901 and had fallen into disrepair
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was rededicated in 1986 and placed into the national register of historic places on june 25 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: before senior year students at the way college left for an interim year as missionaries
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon completion of the four year curriculum graduates receive an accredited degree in theology
lines.name: English

lines.value: way corps duties include providing spiritual leadership at all levels and carrying out decisions made by the board of directors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way has ordained way corps graduates over the years and both men and women serve as clergy
lines.name: English

lines.value: neither graduation from the way corps nor accepting a high leadership position guarantee ordination
lines.name: English

lines.value: a yearly gathering of way followers in new knoxville ohio known as the rock of ages festival was a way event that took place from 1970 until 1995 when it was discontinued
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the purposes of the festival was to welcome home returning word over the world ambassadors the way's first missionary program and to send out a new group on their yearly assignment
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 president l craig martindale and other leaders of the way cancelled the commissioning of world over the world wow ambassadors at the rock of ages conferences after claiming that ten percent of them were homosexual
lines.name: English

lines.value: martindale and the two other trustees donald ernst wierwille vice president and howard allen secretary treasurer agreed that those possessed by homosexual devil spirits had infiltrated the program so it had to be completely shut down
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the program was suspended martindale restructured the wow program by the following summer calling it a way victory
lines.name: English

lines.value: he stated we have flushed homosexuals and homo fantasizers and sympathizers out of our way corps and staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: by early 1995 the way reported 163 sodomites had been purged marked and avoided
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1985 the way published a concordance to the peshitta version of the aramaic new testament followed by a three volume interlinear version of the syriac new testament bible in 1988 after a 15-year effort by the way international biblical research team
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way biblical research team cataloged 600 aramaic manuscripts to compile their new testament text and lexical aids
lines.name: English

lines.value: victor paul wierwille became associated in 1957 with aramaic bible scholar george m lamsa and lamsa finished his translating of the lamsa bible in wierwille's home
lines.name: English

lines.value: lamsa and wierwille produced the first american aramaic grammar in 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille's other major publications include jesus christ our passover jesus christ our promised seed jesus christ is not god are the dead alive now the bible tells me so the new dynamic church the word's way god's magnified word order my steps in thy word and receiving the holy spirit today
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international denies being a denomination or sect
lines.name: English

lines.value: among its notable characteristics there are no special days set for household fellowship meetings which are held regularly and on an informal basis commonly in houses or other transitory facilities
lines.name: English

lines.value: communion is observed at least yearly
lines.name: English

lines.value: in such meetings there is teaching singing praying and speaking in tongues as well as occasional listening to the way's sunday teaching service
lines.name: English

lines.value: most local leaders are not ordained
lines.name: English

lines.value: pentecost is the movement's most important day in the calendar as opposed to christmas or easter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way relies on wierwille's teachings principles and research for its interpretation of the bible
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way uses his oral and written teachings to learn how to apply these research keys and principles
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to wierwille only the new testament epistles apply to christians today given the gospels belong in the old testament
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to kenneth boa wierwille's teaching of dynamic monarchianism was a version of adoptionism a third century heresy which held jesus was a unique man who was specially filled with the power of god p
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille in turn argued that the doctrine of the trinity and the deity of christ were introduced to christianity by pagan converts during the third and fourth centuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its doctrine of god the way posits that elohim god alone is creator of heaven and earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a similar fashion to jehovah's witnesses the way rejects the trinitarian doctrine
lines.name: English

lines.value: jesus christ was a perfect man and was the son of god but not god
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was crucified on wednesday and raised three days later on a saturday afternoon
lines.name: English

lines.value: jesus died upon stakes together with four other individuals two thieves and two malefactors based on the use of different words by luke and matthew specifically kakourgoi and lestai
lines.name: English

lines.value: central to the way's dogma is the notion of holy spirit being an impersonal force given to believers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first adam lost his spirit at the fall and with this went the image of god in man
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the day of pentecost god sent the gift of holy spirit to his disciples which was subsequently manifested by speaking in tongues
lines.name: English

lines.value: people are born as flesh without any spirit
lines.name: English

lines.value: when a person is born again by confessing jesus as lord and believing that god raised him from the dead (), they receive a spirit which is always accompanied by speaking in tongues
lines.name: English

lines.value: followers of the way regularly practice tongues for this reason
lines.name: English

lines.value: redemption is by faith in jesus christ any person who confesses this belief is born again and is therefore a member of the body of christ
lines.name: English

lines.value: in turn salvation includes deliverance from the power of darkness
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille also makes a distinction between the bride of christ and the body of christ the body of christ beginning on the day of pentecost and continuing until the return of christ
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way international rejects the trinity
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike god jesus is not omniscient omnipotent nor omnipresent
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the same time jesus did not exist before his birth except in the foreknowledge of god at his conception god created the sperm to fertilize mary's ovum and is the literal father of jesus
lines.name: English

lines.value: joseph and mary married soon after she became pregnant with jesus and had sexual relations after the birth of jesus
lines.name: English

lines.value: in receiving the holy spirit today the way believes holy spirit is a direct reference to god rather than a separate entity or person
lines.name: English

lines.value: this term is contrasted with the holy spirit which is a reference to a divine gift from god
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille claimed that english translators of the bible missed this distinction and that greek manuscripts were written in uncial script which further confused the subject
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way also posits that there are nine manifestations of the holy spirit and every born again christian can inherently operate all nine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the list is derived from
lines.name: English

lines.value: speaking in tongues energizes the effectual operation of the other eight manifestations
lines.name: English

lines.value: speaking in tongues holds an important place in the way's doctrine for this reason
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were four people crucified with jesus on a wednesday rejecting the standard interpretation which holds that there were two
lines.name: English

lines.value: different greek words were used for those crucified with jesus in the different gospel accounts which together with discrepancies in timing statements and actions of the characters in the narrative moved wierwille to assert these postulations
lines.name: English

lines.value: two malefactors kakourgoi were initially led and crucified with jesus in then two robbers lestai were later crucified after his accusation was fastened in
lines.name: English

lines.value: accordingly two others were crucified on both sides of jesus for a total of four
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the way the cross upon which jesus was crucified was not the traditional t shaped cross but rather a stake or the trunk of a tree
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore jesus did not carry his cross rather after leaving the judgment hall the soldiers immediately compelled simon of cyrene to bear the cross all the way to calvary per the three gospel accounts in and
lines.name: English

lines.value: the one account in which states and he bearing his cross wierwille believed refers to jesus spiritual bearing of sin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the thorn in the flesh in is individuals sent by satan to disrupt the apostle paul's ministry not an illness as it is commonly interpreted
lines.name: English

lines.value: also the dead do not immediately go to heaven or hell but rather death is a continuing state which will end when jesus christ returns for his saints (; ) and with his saints
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this way souls are not immortal thus remaining dead until the final resurrection which is known by some as soul sleep
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille also wrote that the unsaved simply die a second and final death
lines.name: English

lines.value: way followers reject water baptism holding that it wasn't intended as a continuing practice after pentecost and that it applied only to israel
lines.name: English

lines.value: once a person is born again they receive holy spirit and cannot lose it through any sinful acts
lines.name: English

lines.value: tithing one's net income to the church is a recommended minimum taking the example from abraham's donation to melchizedek as well as the instruction in
lines.name: English

lines.value: additional voluntary giving is called abundant sharing and plurality giving based on a disputed principle from the first century church refers to the donation of any excess items the owner feels he no longer needs or has too many of generally within fellowships to help the other members
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way notably believes extreme forms of unusual or destructive behavior i.e violence verbal outbursts alcoholism homosexuality drug abuse mental illness can be evidence that an individual is possessed by a devil spirit
lines.name: English

lines.value: a devil spirit is equivalent to a demon in most other christian cosmologies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way teaches that believers have the power to cast out devil spirits but should only do so if given divine revelation to do so
lines.name: English

lines.value: concerning the exact date and time of the birth of jesus their research places it as september 11 3 bc
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast to evangelical and roman catholic christians the way teaches that abortion is not murder as a fetus does not have breath life and therefore does not have its living soul until it takes its breath when born
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of the late 1980s graduates of the way's advanced class were encouraged to read the books the thirteenth tribe by arthur koestler and did six million really die
lines.name: English

lines.value: by richard verrall
lines.name: English

lines.value: the thirteenth tribe argues that most modern day jews are descendants of the khazars who were a people in modern day eastern turkey who converted to judaism in the 8th century and their descendants became the ashkenazi jews
lines.name: English

lines.value: the book concludes that therefore most modern jews are really imposters
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is not clear if the way subscribes to the correlative theory of british israelism khazar theory of ashkenazi ancestry
lines.name: English

lines.value: another particular way belief is that baptism was instituted by god for israel only only for a limited time
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike most bible based christian sects the way is very tolerant of smoking and drinking
lines.name: English

lines.value: they recommend a two drink limit for leaders
lines.name: English

lines.value: however those participating as active way corps do not partake in any tobacco products
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a general practice mark and avoid means an individual is not allowed to talk with meet with or attend fellowship with people within the way until that individual repents of their supposed wrongdoing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the practice is taken from and was encouraged by martindale after coming out of what he described as the fog years 1986-1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: the way believes that homosexuality is due to the possession of a person by a devil spirit or minion of satan
lines.name: English

lines.value: they reject the idea that homosexuality is genetically determined and believe that it causes confusion in the hearts of many people
lines.name: English

lines.value: through the bible the way says that god teaches that homosexuality is a sin citing thou shall not lie with mankind as with womankind it is abomination
lines.name: English

lines.value: if homosexuality were genetically determined then a homosexual would be destined by god to a lifetime of error and sin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the formation of splinter groups took place in the wake of actions by l craig martindale after his appointment to replace wierwille including the implementation of new rules and beliefs and the dissension among its leadership when chris geer initially read the 40000 word long document titled passing of a patriarch to the trustee leadership and way headquarters staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: in it geer claimed that wierwille during his final weeks revealed observations concerns and recommendations regarding the unbiblical direction of the way and the lack of biblical leadership by martindale
lines.name: English

lines.value: the document was later read to the way corps who disseminated the information throughout the way
lines.name: English

lines.value: many former way leaders broke away forming their own groups and ministries with their own interpretation of wierwille's teachings
lines.name: English

lines.value: side by side comparisons of some of wierwille's earlier books power for abundant living receiving the holy spirit today and the studies in abundant living series with previously published works by other authors including e w bullinger show instances of verbatim copying indicating plagiarism
lines.name: English

lines.value: j e stiles and b g leonard other authors whom wierwille was said to have borrowed from are mentioned by wierwille at various times but not credited as sources in any of wierwille's publications
lines.name: English

lines.value: wierwille's later books published in the 1980s are properly footnoted and credit sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: the piano concerto op 38 by samuel barber was commissioned by the music publishing company g schirmer inc in honor of the centenary of their founding
lines.name: English

lines.value: the work's premiere was on september 24 1962 in the opening festivities of philharmonic hall now david geffen hall the first hall built at lincoln center for the performing arts in manhattan with john browning as soloist with the boston symphony orchestra conducted by erich leinsdorf
lines.name: English

lines.value: barber began work on the concerto in march 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: john browning was the intended soloist from the outset and the concerto was written with his specific keyboard technique in mind
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first two movements were completed before the end of 1960 but the last movement was not completed until 15 days before the world premiere performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to browning in the liner notes for his 1991 rca victor recording of the concerto with the st louis symphony the initial version of the piano part of the third movement was unplayable at performance tempo barber resisted reworking the piano part until vladimir horowitz reviewed it and also deemed it unplayable at full tempo
lines.name: English

lines.value: the work was met with great critical acclaim with barber winning his second pulitzer prize in 1963 and the music critics circle award in 1964
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was recorded by browning with the cleveland orchestra conducted by george szell in 1964 and also played live while being on tour with the cleveland orchestra in europe in 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: he recorded it again in 1991 with the st louis symphony conducted by leonard slatkin on the rca victor red seal label
lines.name: English

lines.value: other recordings include 1976 by the mit symphony orchestra for vox/turnabout a naxos release performed by stephen prutsman with the royal scottish national orchestra under marin alsop and a performance by tedd joselson with the london symphony orchestra directed by andrew schenck
lines.name: English

lines.value: the work is scored for piano solo and an orchestra of piccolo 2 flutes 2 oboes cor anglais 2 clarinets bass clarinet 2 bassoons 4 horns 3 trumpets 3 trombones timpani percussion harp and strings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the work is in three movements
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first movement opens with a piano declamation of one of the major themes and then moves into a furious tutti section
lines.name: English

lines.value: this opening section contains the expression of the movement's chief melodies
lines.name: English

lines.value: through inversion retrograde and counterpoint variations of these melodies which will appear in later movements barber spins out the entire movement
lines.name: English

lines.value: it begins after a tonally ambiguous introduction and ends in e minor (; ).
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second movement predominantly in c sharp minor is based primarily on one sweet but sad melody and is far more subdued than the first movement
lines.name: English

lines.value: this movement was transcribed and expanded from an elegy for flute and piano composed in 1959 for the flautist manfred ibel
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was published in 1962 as canzone elegy op 38a
lines.name: English

lines.value: the third movement mostly in b flat minor is in a furiously fast 5/8 time with a pounding ostinato that gives the piece a rather devilish sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: it makes heavy use of the brass instruments and is driven by the recapitulation of a brief motivic theme giving the movement a modified rondo form
lines.name: English

lines.value: *list of compositions by samuel barber
lines.name: English

lines.value: mary ellen mark march 20 1940 - may 25 2015 was an american photographer known for her photojournalism documentary photography portraiture and advertising photography
lines.name: English

lines.value: she photographed people who were away from mainstream society and toward its more interesting often troubled fringes
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark had 18 collections of her work published most notably streetwise and ward 81
lines.name: English

lines.value: her work was exhibited at galleries and museums worldwide and widely published in life rolling stone the new yorker new york times and vanity fair
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was a member of magnum photos between 1977 and 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: she received numerous accolades including three robert f kennedy journalism awards three fellowships from the national endowment for the arts the 2014 lifetime achievement in photography award from the george eastman house and the outstanding contribution photography award from the world photography organisation
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark was born and raised in elkins park pennsylvania in suburban philadelphia and began photographing with a box brownie camera at age nine
lines.name: English

lines.value: she attended cheltenham high school where she was head cheerleader and exhibited a knack for painting and drawing
lines.name: English

lines.value: she received a bfa degree in painting and art history from the university of pennsylvania in 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: after graduating she worked briefly in the philadelphia city planning department before returning for a master's degree in photojournalism at the annenberg school for communication at the university of pennsylvania which she received in 1964
lines.name: English

lines.value: the following year mark received a fulbright scholarship to photograph in turkey for a year from which she produced her first book passport 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: while there she also traveled to photograph england germany greece italy and spain
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1966 or 1967 she moved to new york city where over the next several years she photographed demonstrations in opposition to the vietnam war the women's liberation movement transvestite culture and times square developing a sensibility according to one writer away from mainstream society and toward its more interesting often troubled fringes
lines.name: English

lines.value: her photography went on to address such social issues as homelessness loneliness drug addiction and prostitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: children are a reoccurring subject throughout much of mark's work
lines.name: English

lines.value: she described her approach to her subjects i've always felt that children and teenagers are not children they're small people
lines.name: English

lines.value: i look at them as little people and i either like them or i don't like them
lines.name: English

lines.value: i also have an obsession with mental illness
lines.name: English

lines.value: and strange people who are outside the borders of society mark also said i'd rather pull up things from another culture that are universal that we can all relate to....there are prostitutes all over the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: i try to show their way of life and that i feel an affinity for people who haven't had the best breaks in society
lines.name: English

lines.value: what i want to do more than anything is acknowledge their existence
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark was well known for establishing strong relationships with her subjects
lines.name: English

lines.value: for ward 81 1979 she lived for six weeks with the patients in the women's security ward of oregon state hospital and for falkland road 1981 she spent three months befriending the prostitutes who worked on a single long street in bombay
lines.name: English

lines.value: her project streets of the lost with writer cheryl mccall for life produced her book streetwise 1988 and was developed into the documentary film streetwise directed by her husband martin bell and with a soundtrack by tom waits
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark was also a unit photographer on movie sets shooting production stills of more than 100 movies including arthur penn's alice's restaurant 1969 mike nichols catch 22 1970 carnal knowledge 1971 and francis ford coppola's apocalypse now 1979 through to baz luhrmann's australia 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: for look magazine she photographed federico fellini shooting satyricon 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark worked with film using a wide range of cameras in various formats from 35 mm 120/220 4x5-inch view camera and a 20x24 polaroid land camera primarily in black and white using kodak tri x film
lines.name: English

lines.value: she published 18 books of photographs contributed to publications including life rolling stone the new yorker new york times and vanity fair and her photographs have been exhibited worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark was transparent with the subjects of her photography about her intent to use what she saw in the world for her art about which she has said i just think it's important to be direct and honest with people about why you're photographing them and what you're doing
lines.name: English

lines.value: after all you are taking some of their soul mark joined magnum photos in 1977 and left in 1981 joining archive pictures and then in 1988 opened her own agency
lines.name: English

lines.value: she served as a guest juror for photography call for entries at the center for fine art photography and taught workshops at the international center of photography in new york in mexico and at the center for photography at woodstock
lines.name: English

lines.value: she co wrote and was associate producer and still photographer for the feature film american heart 1992 starring jeff bridges and edward furlong and directed by martin bell
lines.name: English

lines.value: it depicts a gruff ex convict who struggles to get his life back on track
lines.name: English

lines.value: mark died on may 25 2015 in manhattan aged 75 of myelodysplastic syndrome a blood illness caused by bone marrow failure
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1968 he was made an officer of the order of canada

lines.value: in law sua sponte latin of his her its or their own accord or suo motu on its own motion describes an act of authority taken without formal prompting from another party
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term is usually applied to actions by a judge taken without a prior motion or request from the parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: the form nostra sponte of our own accord is sometimes used by the court itself when the action is taken by a multi member court such as an appellate court rather than by a single judge third parties describing such actions would still refer to them as being taken by the court as a whole and therefore as sua sponte
lines.name: English

lines.value: while usually applied to actions of a court the term may reasonably be applied to actions by government agencies and individuals acting in official capacity
lines.name: English

lines.value: one situation in which a party might encourage a judge to move sua sponte occurs when that party is preserving a special appearance usually to challenge jurisdiction and therefore cannot make motions on its own behalf without making a general appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: common reasons for an action taken sua sponte are when the judge determines that the court does not have subject matter jurisdiction or that the case should be moved to another judge because of a conflict of interest even if all parties disagree
lines.name: English

lines.value: * motu proprio
lines.name: English

lines.value: she earned a ba in political science at the university of calgary later receiving an honours degree in journalism from carleton university in ottawa and an mfa from the university of british columbia in vancouver where she currently resides
lines.name: English

lines.value: gartner started her career as a newspaper and magazine journalist for a number of publications including the vancouver sun the globe and mail saturday night quill and quire the georgia straight western living and canadian business
lines.name: English

lines.value: her work has brought her three western magazine awards including a gold award in 2003 for feature writing

lines.value: she has worked as a senior editor at saturday night and books editor for the georgia straight

lines.value: her 2011 collection of short stories better living through plastic explosives was a shortlisted nominee for the 2011 scotiabank giller prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: she is also a writer of short stories which have appeared in a number of publications

lines.value: she published a collection of these stories all the anxious girls on earth in 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: and her 2011 collection of short stories better living through plastic explosives was a shortlisted nominee for the 2011 scotiabank giller prize

lines.value: gartner has been writer in residence at the university of british columbia and a member of the faculty at banff centre's writing studios

lines.value: william kerr first earl of lothian of a new creation 1605-1675 was a scottish nobleman
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was appointed one of the four commissioners of the treasury in 1642 was lieutenant general of the scots army in ireland and was appointed privy councillor in the same year
lines.name: English

lines.value: he entered parliament in 1644 and joined lord argyll in expedition against lord montrose during the wars of the three kingdoms in 1644
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was one of the commissioners sent to treat with the king at holmby house in 1647
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was appointed secretary of state in 1649 and was one of the commissioners sent by the scottish parliament to protest against proceeding to extremities against the king
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a general of the scottish forces in 1650
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1662 he refused to take the abjuration oath
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eldest son of sir robert kerr later 1st earl of ancram he was born within st james's palace in london and was educated at cambridge university and at paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: he accompanied george villiers 1st duke of buckingham to the isle of rhe in 1627 and served in the expedition against spain in 1631
lines.name: English

lines.value: he married anne kerr 3rd countess of lothian in 1630 and was created lord kerr of newbattle and earl of lothianin his own right in 1631
lines.name: English

lines.value: he signed the national covenant in 1638 and was governor of newcastle in the same year
lines.name: English

lines.value: que sera sera whatever will be will be first published in 1956 is a popular song written by the songwriting team of jay livingston and ray evans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song was introduced in the alfred hitchcock film the man who knew too much 1956 starring doris day and james stewart in the lead roles
lines.name: English

lines.value: day's recording of the song for columbia records catalog number 40704 made it to number two on the billboard hot 100 and number one in the uk singles chart
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1968 to 1973 it was the theme song for the sitcom the doris day show becoming her signature song
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three verses of the song progress through the life of the narrator from childhood through young adulthood and falling in love to parenthood and each asks what will i be or what lies ahead the chorus repeats the answer what will be will be it reached the billboard magazine charts in july 1956
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song in the man who knew too much received the 1956 academy award for best original song with the alternative title whatever will be will be que sera sera
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the third oscar in this category for livingston and evans who previously won in 1948 and 1950
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 it finished at 48 in afi's 100 years...100 songs survey of top tunes in american cinema
lines.name: English

lines.value: the title sequence of the hitchcock film gives the song title as whatever will be
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was a 1 hit in australia for pop singer normie rowe in september 1965
lines.name: English

lines.value: the popularity of the song has led to curiosity about the origins of the saying and the identity of its language
lines.name: English

lines.value: both the spanish like spelling used by livingston and evans and an italian like form che sara sara are first documented in the 16th century as an english heraldic motto
lines.name: English

lines.value: the spanish form appears on a brass plaque in the church of st nicholas thames ditton surrey dated 1559
lines.name: English

lines.value: the italian form was first adopted as a family motto by either john russell 1st earl of bedford or his son francis russell 2nd earl of bedford
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is said by some sources to have been adopted by the elder russell after his experience at the battle of pavia 1525 and to be engraved on his tomb 1555 n.s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2nd earl's adoption of the motto is commemorated in a manuscript dated 1582
lines.name: English

lines.value: their successors earls and later dukes of bedford sixth creation as well as other aristocratic families continued to use the motto
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon after its adoption as a heraldic motto it appeared in christopher marlowe's play doctor faustus written ca 1590 published 1604 whose text act 1 scene 1 contains a line with the archaic italian spelling che sera sera what will be shall be
lines.name: English

lines.value: early in the 17th century the saying begins to appear in the speech and thoughts of fictional characters as a spontaneous expression of a fatalistic attitude
lines.name: English

lines.value: the saying is always in an english speaking context and has no history in spain italy or france and in fact is ungrammatical in all three romance languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is composed of spanish or italian words superimposed on english syntax
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was evidently formed by a word for word mistranslation of english what will be will be merging the free relative pronoun what = that which with the interrogative what
lines.name: English

lines.value: livingston and evans had some knowledge of spanish and early in their career they worked together as musicians on cruise ships to the caribbean and south america
lines.name: English

lines.value: composer jay livingston had seen the 1954 hollywood film the barefoot contessa in which a fictional italian family has the motto che sara sara carved in stone at their ancestral mansion
lines.name: English

lines.value: he immediately wrote it down as a possible song title and he and lyricist ray evans later gave it a spanish spelling because there are so many spanish speaking people in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: in modern times thanks to the popularity of the song and its many translations the phrase has been adopted in countries around the world to name a variety of entities including books movies restaurants vacation rentals airplanes and race horses
lines.name: English

lines.value: australian pop singer normie rowe's 1965 recording of que sera sera which was produced by pat aulton on the sunshine record label sunshine qk 1103 was the biggest hit of his career the biggest australian rock n roll hit of 1965 and is reputed to be the biggest selling australian single of the 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song was done in the style of louie louie and the manner of hang on sloopy and given a merseybeat treatment in the manner of the beatles twist & shout and was backed by rowe's band the playboys
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was paired with a powerful version of the johnny kidd & the pirates classic shaking all over and the single became a double sided no
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1 hit in most capitals #1 sydney 1 melbourne 1 brisbane 1 adelaide and perth
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1965 charting for 28 weeks and selling in unprecedented numbers with rock historian ian mcfarlane reporting sales of 80000 copies while 1970s encyclopedist noel mcgrath claimed sales of 100000
lines.name: English

lines.value: rowe scored another first in october 1965 when que sera sera became his third hit single in the melbourne top 40 simultaneously
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1965 rowe received a gold record for que sera sera at sydney's prestigious chevron hotel
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 1965 the master of rowe's version was purchased by jay gee records for release in the usa
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 1966 rowe received a second gold record for the sales of que sera sera
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 1966 rowe won radio 5ka's annual best male vocal award for que sera sera
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 rowe released a newly recorded version which was released by abc via itunes and later adding the whole digital mix with a radio mix and a dance mix
lines.name: English

lines.value: other versions of que sera sera include english language versions
lines.name: English

lines.value: matthew cooke 1829–1887 was an irish immigrant to the united states who pioneered economic entomology in california
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in bushmills county antrim on february 16 1829 matthew cookie immigrated to the united states in 1850
lines.name: English

lines.value: employed as a youth in the public works department in bushmills he was promoted to superintendent of works
lines.name: English

lines.value: in california he first took up a post at the water works in scaremento and in 1875 became a fruit box manufacturer
lines.name: English

lines.value: his business suffered badly when the codling moth appeared in the state devastating the apple crop
lines.name: English

lines.value: he studied entomology to solve the problem and by 1879 was able to address the state fruit growers on the codling moth and other serious pests including those of the important wine crop
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1881 he was appointed chief executive horticultural and health officer of california and drew up quarantine regulations relating to insects
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cherry fruit sawfly hoplocampa cookei was named for him by w t clarcke
lines.name: English

lines.value: he died at sacramento on august 25 1887 california's first economic entomologist
lines.name: English

lines.value: the matthew cooke entomological chart shows similarities with those produced by robert patterson in belfast
lines.name: English

lines.value: patterson charts were widely used in the usa
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote numerous pamphlets and articles mostly published in the pacific rural press and the sacramento daily record union
lines.name: English

lines.value: * bhl scanned injurious insects of the orchard vineyard field garden conservatory household storehouse domestic animals etc with remedies for their extermination
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde berhan gebre egziabher born 1940 in adwa,tigray is an ethiopian who won the right livelihood award in 2000 for his exemplary work to safeguard biodiversity and the traditional rights of farmers and communities to their genetic resources
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde berhan was born in adwa tigray on february 19 1940
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended negeste saba queen of sheba elementary school in adwa from october 1951 to june 1955
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde was accepted to general wingate secondary school in addis ababa and studied there from september 1955 to july 1959
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was then accepted to addis ababa then haile selassie i university addis ababa where he studied from september 1959 to july 1963 and won the chancellor's gold medal for best graduate in the faculty of science
lines.name: English

lines.value: he studied at the school of plant biology university of north wales from october 1966-nov 1969 and was awarded a phd under prof p greig smith
lines.name: English

lines.value: phd
lines.name: English

lines.value: he worked in the biology department at addis ababa university from 1963 serving as a graduate assistant assistant lecturer and assistant professor
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was appointed dean of the faculty of science in 1974 and served in this capacity until 1978 when he was appointed associate professor of biology
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1978 he also began working part time with the ethiopian science and technology commission as leader of the idrc unu sponsored research project research and development in rural settings
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1980 to 1996 he was project leader of the ethiopian flora project
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was appointed president of asmara university in 1983 and held this post until 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: from march 1995 he has served as the general manager of the ethiopian environmental protection authority
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1990s tewolde put much of his energy into negotiations at the various biodiversity related fora especially the convention on biological diversity cbd and the food and agriculture organization
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this time he built up a strong group of well prepared african negotiators who began to take the lead in the g77 and china group
lines.name: English

lines.value: africa came out with united strong progressive positions such as no patents on living materials and the recognition of community rights
lines.name: English

lines.value: this strengthened the g77 and china's negotiating positions
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde was instrumental in securing recommendations from the organisation of african unity oau encouraging african countries to develop and implement community rights a common position on trade related aspects of intellectual property rights and a clear stance against patents on life
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde also guided the drafting of the oau model legislation for community rights which is now used as the common basis for all african countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 1999 biosafety negotiations in cartagena colombia tewolde was the spokesperson for the majority of the g77 countries called the like minded group
lines.name: English

lines.value: these negotiations ended in deadlock but reached a successful conclusion in montreal in january 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde's leadership of the like minded group in the negotiations played a key role in achieving an outcome against strong us and eu opposition that protects biosafety and biodiversity and respects traditional and community rights in developing countries
lines.name: English

lines.value: tewolde berhan is also named one of the 2006 winners of the united nations top environmental prize champions of the earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is a member of the world future council
lines.name: English

lines.value: * right livelihood award 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: * councillor at world future council
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nicaraguan armed forces are the military forces of nicaragua
lines.name: English

lines.value: the long years of strife between the peasant and land owning political factions and the existence of private armies led the united states to sponsor the national guard as an apolitical institution to assume all military and police functions in nicaragua
lines.name: English

lines.value: the marines provided the training but their efforts were complicated by a guerrilla movement led by augusto cesar sandino that continued to resist the marines and the fledgling national guard from a stronghold in the mountainous areas of northern nicaragua
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon the advent of the united states good neighbor policy in 1933 the marines withdrew
lines.name: English

lines.value: having reached a strength of about 3000 by the mid 1930s the guard was organized into company units although the presidential guard component approached battalion size
lines.name: English

lines.value: expanded to no more than 9000 during the civil war of 1978-79 the guard consisted of a reinforced battalion as its primary tactical unit a presidential guard battalion a mechanized company an engineer battalion artillery and antiaircraft batteries and one security company in each of the country's sixteen departments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national guard's main arms were m1 garands and israeli galils later augmented by antiaircraft guns and mortars
lines.name: English

lines.value: nicaragua declared war on the axis powers in 1941 immediately after the japanese attack on pearl harbor
lines.name: English

lines.value: although nicaragua was not actively involved in world war ii it qualified for united states lend lease military aid in exchange for us base facilities at corinto
lines.name: English

lines.value: additional shipments of small arms and transportation and communication equipment followed as well as some training and light transport aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: united states military aid to the national guard continued under the rio de janeiro treaty of mutual defense 1947 but stopped in 1976 after relations with the administration of anastasio somoza debayle 1967-72 1974 79 worsened
lines.name: English

lines.value: some united states equipment of world war ii vintage was also purchased from other countries staghound armored cars and m4 sherman medium tanks from israel and f 51 mustang fighter aircraft from sweden
lines.name: English

lines.value: except for minor frontier skirmishes with honduras in 1957 over a border dispute the national guard was not involved in any conflict with its neighbors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the guard's domestic power however gradually broadened to embrace not only its original internal security and police functions but also control over customs telecommunications port facilities radio broadcasting the merchant marine and civil aviation
lines.name: English

lines.value: to replace the national guard the sandinistas established a new national army the sandinista popular army ejercito popular sandinista eps and a police force the sandinista police policia sandinista
lines.name: English

lines.value: these two groups contrary to the original puntarenas pact were controlled by the sandinistas and trained by personnel from cuba eastern europe and the soviet union
lines.name: English

lines.value: opposition to the overwhelming fsln influence in the security forces did not surface until 1980
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile the eps developed with support from cuba and the soviet union into the largest and best equipped military force in central america
lines.name: English

lines.value: compulsory military service introduced during 1983 brought the eps forces to about 80000 by the mid 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conscription law was abolished in 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: under an agreement between president elect chamorro of the national opposition union union nacional oppositora - uno and the defeated fsln party general humberto ortega former defense minister and commander in chief of the eps under the sandinistas remained at the head of the armed forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: by a law that took effect in april 1990 the eps became subordinate to president chamorro as commander in chief
lines.name: English

lines.value: chamorro also retained the ministry of defense portfolio
lines.name: English

lines.value: chamorro's authority over the eps was very limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were no ministry of defense offices and no vice ministers to shape national defense policies or exercise civilian control over the armed forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the law of military organization of the sandinista popular army enacted just before chamorro's election victory humberto ortega retained authority over promotions military construction and force deployments
lines.name: English

lines.value: he contracted for weapons procurement and drafted the military budget presented to the government
lines.name: English

lines.value: only an overall budget had to be submitted to the legislature thus avoiding a line item review by the national assembly
lines.name: English

lines.value: sandinista officers remained at the head of all general staff directorates and military regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the chief of the army major general joaquin cuadra lacayo continued in his pre chamorro position
lines.name: English

lines.value: facing domestic pressure to remove humberto ortega and the risk of curtailment of united states aid as long as sandinistas remained in control of the armed forces chamorro announced that ortega would be replaced in 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: ortega challenged her authority to relieve him and reiterated his intention to remain at the head of the eps until the army reform program was completed in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: the army reform measures were launched with deep cuts in personnel strengths the abolition of conscription and disbanding of the militia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the size of the army declined from a peak strength of 97000 troops to an estimated 15200 in 1993 accomplished by voluntary discharges and forced retirements
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the sandinistas the army general staff embodied numerous branches and directorates artillery combat readiness communications frontier guards military construction intelligence counterintelligence training operations organization and mobilization personnel and logistics
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of these bodies appear to have been retained although they have been trimmed and reorganized
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nicaraguan air force and navy were also subordinate to the army general staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 1990 the mission of the eps has been to ensure the security of the national borders and to deal with internal disturbances
lines.name: English

lines.value: its primary task has been to prevent disorder and violence wrought by armed bands of former contra and sandinista soldiers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november and december 1992 the eps was deployed alongside the national police to prevent violence during demonstrations by the national workers front for improved pay and benefits
lines.name: English

lines.value: the eps and the frontier guards also assist the police in narcotics control
lines.name: English

lines.value: a small eps contingent works alongside demobilized contras in a special disarmament brigade to reduce the arsenal of weapons in civilian hands
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the constitutional reforms made in 1995 the eps got its current apolitical nature turning into a professional national military institution newly named ejercito de nicaragua national army of nicaragua
lines.name: English

lines.value: the national army today is mandated not just as a force for national defense but also for public security civil defense and national development
lines.name: English

lines.value: he pushes them back across the pyrenees and the muslims retreat to the andalusian heartland after 40 years of occupation

lines.value: its ruler khurshid ii flees into the mountainous region of daylam

lines.value: customer premises equipment or customer provided equipment cpe is any terminal and associated equipment located at a subscriber's premises and connected with a carrier's telecommunication circuit at the demarcation point demarc
lines.name: English

lines.value: the demarc is a point established in a building or complex to separate customer equipment from the equipment located in either the distribution infrastructure or central office of the communications service provider
lines.name: English

lines.value: cpe generally refers to devices such as telephones routers network switches residential gateways rg set top boxes fixed mobile convergence products home networking adapters and internet access gateways that enable consumers to access communications service providers services and distribute them around their house via a local area network lan
lines.name: English

lines.value: a cpe can be an active equipment as the ones mentioned above or a passive equipment such as analogue telephone adapters or xdsl splitters
lines.name: English

lines.value: included are key telephone systems and most private branch exchanges
lines.name: English

lines.value: excluded from cpe are overvoltage protection equipment and pay telephones
lines.name: English

lines.value: other types of materials that are necessary for the delivery of the telecommunication service but are not defined as equipment such as manuals and cable packages and cable adapters are instead referred to as cpe peripherals
lines.name: English

lines.value: cpe can refer to devices purchased by the subscriber or to those provided by the operator or service provider
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two phrases customer premises equipment and customer provided equipment reflect the history of this equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: under the bell system monopoly in the united states post communications act of 1934 the bell system owned the phones and one could not attach one's own devices to the network or even attach anything to the phones
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus phones were property of the bell system located on customers premises hence customer premises equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the us federal communications commission fcc proceeding the second computer inquiry the fcc ruled that telecommunications carriers could no longer bundle cpe with telecommunications service uncoupling the market power of the telecommunications service monopoly from the cpe market and creating a competitive cpe market
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the gradual breakup of the bell monopoly starting with hush a phone v united states [1956] which allowed some non bell owned equipment to be connected to the network a process called interconnection equipment on customers premises became increasingly owned by customers not the telco
lines.name: English

lines.value: indeed one eventually became able to purchase one's own phone hence customer provided equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the pay tv industry many operators and service providers offer subscribers a set top box with which to receive video services in return for a monthly fee
lines.name: English

lines.value: as offerings have evolved to include multiple services [voice and data] operators have increasingly given consumers the opportunity to rent or buy additional devices like access modems internet gateways and video extenders that enable them to access multiple services and distribute them to a range of consumer electronics devices around the home
lines.name: English

lines.value: the growth of multiple service operators offering triple or quad play services required the development of hybrid cpe to make it easy for subscribers to access voice video and data services
lines.name: English

lines.value: the development of this technology was led by pay tv operators looking for a way to deliver video services via both traditional broadcast and broadband ip networks
lines.name: English

lines.value: spain's telefonica was the first operator to launch a hybrid broadcast and broadband tv service in 2003 with its movistar tv dtt/iptv offering while polish satellite operator n was the first to offer its subscribers a three way hybrid or tri brid broadcast and broadband tv service which launched in 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term set back box is used in the digital tv industry to describe a piece of consumer hardware that enables them to access both linear broadcast and internet based video content plus a range of interactive services like electronic programme guides epg pay per view ppv and video on demand vod as well as internet browsing and view them on a large screen television set
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike standard set top boxes which sit on top of or below the tv a set back box has a smaller form factor to enable it to be mounted to the rear of the display panel flat panel tv hiding it from view
lines.name: English

lines.value: a residential gateway is a home networking device used to connect devices in the home to the internet or other wan
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is an umbrella term used to cover multi function networking appliances used in homes which may combine a dsl modem or cable modem a network switch a consumer grade router and a wireless access point
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the past such functions were provided by separate devices but in recent years technological convergence has enabled multiple functions to be merged into a single device
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the first home gateway devices to be launched was selected by telecom italia to enable the operator to offer triple play services in 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with a sip voip handset for making voice calls it enabled subscribers to access voice video and data services over a 10mb symmetrical adsl fiber connection
lines.name: English

lines.value: the virtual gateway concept enables consumers to access video and data services and distribute them around their homes using software rather than hardware
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first virtual gateway was introduced in 2010 by advanced digital broadcast at the ibc exhibition in amsterdam
lines.name: English

lines.value: the adb virtual gateway uses software that resides within the middleware and is based on open standards including dlna home networking and the dtcp ip standard to ensure that all content including paid for encrypted content like pay tv services can only be accessed by secure ce devices
lines.name: English

lines.value: a subscriber unit or su is a broadband radio that is installed at a business or residential location to connect to an access point to send receive high speed data wired or wirelessly
lines.name: English

lines.value: devices commonly referred to as a subscriber unit include cable modems access gateways home networking adapters and mobile phones
lines.name: English

lines.value: the terms customer premises equipment customer provided equipment or cpe may also refer to any devices that terminate a wan circuit such as an isdn e carrier/t carrier dsl or metro ethernet
lines.name: English

lines.value: this includes any customer owned hardware at the customer's site routers firewalls network switches pbxs voip gateways sometimes csu/dsu and modems
lines.name: English
