lines.value: auckland university of technology aut () is a university in new zealand formed on 1 january 2000 when a former technical college originally established in 1895 was granted university status
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has five faculties across three campuses in auckland city north and south campuses and an additional three specialist locations aut millennium warkworth radio astronomical observatory and aut centre for refugee education
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut enrolled more than 29000 students in 2016 including 4194 international students from 94 countries and 2417 postgraduate students
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut's student population is diverse with a range of ethnic backgrounds including new zealand european asian maori and pasifika
lines.name: English

lines.value: students also represent a wide age range with 22% being aged 25 39 years and 10% being 40 or older
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut employed 2474 full time equivalent fte staff in 2016 including both professional and academic
lines.name: English

lines.value: data suggests that 86% of aut's graduates are employed full time within nine months of graduating
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 2016 qs world university ranking aut was ranked as 441 450
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut was founded as auckland technical school in 1895 offering evening classes only
lines.name: English

lines.value: daytime classes began in 1906 and its name was changed to auckland technical college
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1913 it was renamed seddon memorial technical college
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1960s educational reforms resulted in the separation of secondary and tertiary teaching two educational establishments were formed the tertiary polytechnic adopting the name auckland technical institute ati in 1963 and the secondary school continuing with the same name
lines.name: English

lines.value: for three years they co existed on the same site but by 1964 the secondary school had moved to a new site in western springs and eventually became western springs college
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1989 ati became auckland institute of technology ait and the current name was adopted when university status was granted in 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first chancellor of aut was sir paul reeves
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut has three campuses city in auckland cbd north and south and the training institute millennium
lines.name: English

lines.value: city and north campuses offer student accommodation
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut runs a shuttle bus service between the three campuses
lines.name: English

lines.value: city campus spreads over several sites in the heart of central auckland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest site is situated on wellesley street east and is home to most of the academic units and central administration including the vice chancellor's office and research centres
lines.name: English

lines.value: the faculties of business economics and law design and creative technologies culture and society and te ara poutama share this location
lines.name: English

lines.value: facilities of the campus include an early childhood centre international student centre printing centre gym chinese centre pasifika student support service postgraduate centre and te tari awhina learning development centre
lines.name: English

lines.value: the central library holds over 245000 books and journals on four floors
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are cafes restaurants and bars including the student owned vesbar
lines.name: English

lines.value: training restaurants piko restaurant and four seasons restaurant have operated commercially since 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is also a marae the aut shop st paul st art gallery a university bookshop and the wellesley student apartments
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recent building project completion is the $98 million wg precinct at the city campus
lines.name: English

lines.value: named after the former chancellor of the university the sir paul reeves building hosts the school of communication studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 12 storey building was officially opened by prime minister john key on 22 march 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: it provides an additional learning space of about 20000 square metres that consists of convention spaces screen and television studios and a motion capture sound and performance studio
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut opened south campus formerly manukau campus in 2010 creating the first university campus based in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: it offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees in business computer and information sciences education health sciences year 1 of law as well as sports management and science
lines.name: English

lines.value: south campus hosts its own library student lounges student information centre course information centre computer labs wireless network and cafe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the campus also boasts astro turf courts with tennis basketball netball volleyball touch and soccer equipment available for hire
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 the university invested significantly in the construction of the mana hauora mh building
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction of mh was completed in december 2016 and was officially opened by prime minister bill english in march 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the largest building on campus mh is now the new heart of the campus and incorporates a number of sustainability design features
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2017 three awards were given in recognition of the new mh building at the new zealand institute of architects nzia auckland regional awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: north campus is located on akoranga drive in northcote
lines.name: English

lines.value: the faculty of health and environmental sciences including the sport and recreation division and school of education share this campus which has park like grounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut's main sport and fitness centre is located at the campus encompassing a gymnasium weights room testing equipment golf swing clinic and indoor courts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the campus also offers a library student services centre early childhood centre ausm branch printsprint shop health counselling and wellbeing centre university bookshop and food outlets
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the campus provides five health clinics oral physiotherapy podiatry psychotherapy and ultrasound which are now located at the northmed health clinic building at 3 akoranga drive northcote since july 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: north campus is closely linked with the nearby aut millennium institute of sport and health
lines.name: English

lines.value: like aut north campus the millennium institute is located on auckland's north shore at mairangi bay
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut millennium provides sports training and hosts national and local sports organisations including swimming new zealand new zealand water polo northsport olympic weightlifting and sport and recreation new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: the institute has training facilities athlete accommodation sports science laboratories an aquatics facility and a commercial gym
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut maintains a number of facilities off campus including the aut radio telescope new zealand's first radio telescope
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 12m telescope is located near warkworth and is part of new zealand's and australia's involvement in the international mega science project the square kilometre array
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aut/new zealand alliance won the highly commended award in the innovation excellence in research category at the 2016 new zealand innovation awards
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut's centre for refugee education located in mangere provides an on arrival six week education programme for the 1000 refugees who come to new zealand each year under the government quota scheme
lines.name: English

lines.value: the education programme teaches english language skills at early childhood primary secondary and adult levels as well as orientation to life in new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: with a new set of learners arriving every two months and with ages ranging from early childhood to adult the teaching team has developed a curriculum that gives refugees english and life skills but remains flexible in order to tailor the lessons to each new intake
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut has five faculties
lines.name: English

lines.value: these are
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut offers undergraduate and postgraduate both phd and master degrees as well as sub degree qualifications such as diplomas and certificates
lines.name: English

lines.value: programmes are offered in the areas fields of applied sciences art and design business business information systems communication studies computer and information sciences education engineering health care practice hospitality and tourism languages law mathematical science midwifery nursing occupational therapy oral health paramedicine and emergency management maori development physiotherapy podiatry psychology psychotherapy public health rehabilitation and occupation studies social science and sport and recreation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aut business school has been recognised as one of the top business schools in the world by the association to advance collegiate schools of business aacsb international
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a relatively new university aut came in eighth place in the 2006 performance based research fund pbrf round but has shown the greatest improvement in pbrf rating of new zealand's eight universities
lines.name: English

lines.value: research partnerships and exchanges have been established with some of the world's leading universities
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut's growing research profile has seen an increase in research programme enrolments and external funding as well as research institutions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university opened new research centres and institutes in 2016 bringing the total number to more than 60 covering a wide range of disciplines
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2016 aut's quality assured research outputs increased by 9% to more than 2000 outputs including publication in leading international journals
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new zealand tourism research institute nztri brings together local and international experts in tourism and hospitality
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was established in 1999 by professor simon milne and is located in the school of hospitality and tourism
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2010 the institute brought together 19 researchers as well as 15 phd students several other graduate students being linked to the institute in more informal ways
lines.name: English

lines.value: nztri conducts research projects around the world and has developed strong links with hu university in vietnam wageningen university in the netherlands university of akureyri in iceland mcgill university and york university in canada among others
lines.name: English

lines.value: its research programme areas include coastal and marine tourism community development cultural heritage tourism event tourism health and wellness tourism hospitality research indigenous tourism pacific islands tourism tourism marketing and tourism technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the institute has a team of research officers international interns and other allied staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pacific media centre pmc is located within the school of communication studies
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was founded in 2007 to develop media and journalism research in new zealand particularly involving maori pacific islands ethnic and vernacular media topics
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is recognised as a diversity project by the human rights commission new zealand and has been featured by the panos london media development programme for its development communication work
lines.name: English

lines.value: the centre publishes asia pacific journalism and has published pacific scoop since 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also publishes media and communication studies books like the 2009 book communication culture and society in papua new guinea yo tok wanem in collaboration with other publishers or overseas universities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the center was featured as a creative commons case study in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: founding director david robie a new zealand author journalist and media academic won a vice chancellor's award in 2011 for excellence in university teaching
lines.name: English

lines.value: pacific media watch is pmc's daily independent asia pacific media monitoring service and research project
lines.name: English

lines.value: the site was launched in sydney in october 1996 and has links with the university of the south pacific the university of png upng and the australian centre for independent journalism acij
lines.name: English

lines.value: since moving to aut in 2007 it has become a digital repository and received a grant from the pacific development and conservation trust in 2010 to expand its educational and research role for the pacific region
lines.name: English

lines.value: pmw has established a pactok server archive and added a d space archive in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: representatives of pacific media watch report on the region's news developments provide advocacy for media freedom and published a media freedom report on the south pacific in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: pmc has also published pacific journalism review a peer reviewed research journal on media issues and communication in the south pacific and australia since 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: the journal was previously published at the university of papua new guinea from 1994 to 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: the editorial policy focuses on the cultural politics of the media including new media and social movements the culture of indigenous peoples the politics of tourism and development the role of the media and the formation of national identity
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also covers environmental and development studies in the media and communication and vernacular media in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2010 pjr was awarded the creative stimulus award for academic journals in the inaugural academy awards of the global creative industries in beijing china
lines.name: English

lines.value: the journal has advocated free speech and freedom of information in the asia pacific region
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 2018 qs world university rankings aut was ranked in the 441-450 band which puts it in the top 2% of universities worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2017 times higher education the world university ranking ranked aut as one of the top 20 universities worldwide for international outlook due to its high proportion of international staff students and research partnerships
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut was amongst the world's top 60 young universities and ranked for the first time in the's top 150 universities under 50 years old
lines.name: English

lines.value: aut now features amongst the world's elite institutions in 11 subjects featuring in the qs world university rankings for

lines.value: ausm auckland student movement is the students association at aut

lines.value: every student attending a course run by aut university is a member of ausm and its primary function is to promote and maintain the rights and welfare of students

lines.value: debate was recognised by the aotearoa student press association awards in 2005 best small publication rebecca williams editor and 2009 best humourist ryan boyd editor and best original photography clinton cardozo designer

lines.value: ausm also produces an annual student diary and wallplanner and operates social media accounts

lines.value: ausm supports more than 40 affiliated clubs and organises concerts comedy shows live djs dance parties the annual orientation festival and other events

lines.value: a significant proportion of victims of rape or other sexual violence incidents are male
lines.name: English

lines.value: generally rape is still thought to be a crime against women specifically and has been historically defined this way although many cases of male victim rape have become subject of public discussion
lines.name: English

lines.value: rape of males is still taboo and has a negative connotation among both heterosexual and homosexual men
lines.name: English

lines.value: community and service providers often react to the sexual orientation of male victims and the gender of their perpetrators
lines.name: English

lines.value: mostly male victims try to hide and deny their victimization similar to female victims unless they have serious physical injuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually the male victims may be very vague in explaining their injuries when they are seeking medical or mental health services
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is difficult for a male victim heterosexual or gay to report the sexual assault that was experienced by him especially in a society with a strong masculine custom
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are afraid that people will doubt their sexual orientation and label them as gay
lines.name: English

lines.value: a perception of being gay is also a motive for rape in many cases
lines.name: English

lines.value: the research about male victim rape only appeared less than 30 years ago mostly focused on male children
lines.name: English

lines.value: the studies of sexual assault in correctional facilities focusing specifically on the consequences of this kind of rape was available in the early 1980s but nothing was available during the previous years
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the literature regarding rape and sexual assault focuses on female victims
lines.name: English

lines.value: only recently have some other forms of sexual violence against men been considered
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 2010 2012 national intimate partner and sexual violence survey and a prior edition of this study completed in 2010 the centers for disease control cdc measured a category of sexual violence called being made to penetrate which captures instances in which victims were forced to or attempt to sexually penetrate someone of either sex either by physical force or coercion or when the victim was intoxicated or otherwise unable to consent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cdc found in the 2012 data that 1.715 million up from 1.267 million in 2010 reported being made to penetrate another person in the preceding 12 months similar to the 1.473 million 2010 1.270 million women who reported being raped in the same time period
lines.name: English

lines.value: the definitions of rape and made to penetrate in the cdc study were worded with extremely similar language
lines.name: English

lines.value: male on male rape has been heavily stigmatized
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to psychologist sarah crome fewer than 1 in 10 male male rapes are reported
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a group male rape victims reported a lack of services and support and legal systems are often ill equipped to deal with this type of crime
lines.name: English

lines.value: several studies argue that male male prisoner rape as well as female female prisoner rape are common types of rape which go unreported even more frequently than rape in the general population
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rape of men by men has been documented as a weapon of terror in warfare see also war rape
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the case of the syrian civil war 2011-present the male detainees experienced sexual abuse such as being forced to sit on a broken glass bottle getting their genitals tied to a heavy bag of water or being forced to watch the rape of another detainee by the officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: female on male rape is underresearched compared to other forms of sexual violence
lines.name: English

lines.value: statistics on the prevalence of female on male sexual violence vary
lines.name: English

lines.value: one study hannon et al found 23.4% of women and 10.5% of men reported they were raped while 6.6% of women and 10.5% of men reported they were victims of attempted rape
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2010 2012 study by the centers for disease control and prevention cdc found that 86.5% of male rape victims reported only male perpetrators down from 93.3% in the previous study published in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: one in 17 men 5.9% reported being made to penetrate at some point in their lives up from 4.8% in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: the surveys also found that male victims often reported only female perpetrators in instances of being made to penetrate 2012 78.5% 2010 79.2% sexual coercion 2012 81.6% 2010 83.6% and unwanted sexual contact 2012 53.0% 2010 53.1%
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 2008 study of 98 men interviewed on the united states national crime victimization survey found that nearly half of the men 46% who reported some form of sexual victimization were victimized by women
lines.name: English

lines.value: regarding female on male sexual misconduct the us dept of justice reports in its opening statement page 5 an estimated 4.4% of prison inmates and 3.1% of jail inmates reported experiencing one or more incidents of sexual victimization by another inmate or facility staff in the past 12 months or since admission to the facility if less than 12 months regarding female on male sexual misconduct page 25 it states among the 39121 male prison inmates who had been victims of staff sexual misconduct 69% reported sexual activity with female staff an additional 16% reported sexual activity with both female and male staff table 18 and nearly two thirds of the male jail inmates who had been victimized said the staff perpetrator was female 64% male victims of sexual abuse by females often face social political and legal double standards
lines.name: English

lines.value: the case of cierra ross sexual assault of a man in chicago gained national headlines and ross was convicted of aggravated criminal sexual abuse and armed robbery with a bail set at $75000
lines.name: English

lines.value: a similar case includes james landrith who was made to penetrate a female acquaintance in a hotel room while incapacitated from drinking while his rapist cited the fact that she was pregnant to advise him not to struggle as this might hurt the baby
lines.name: English

lines.value: several widely publicized cases of female on male statutory rape in the united states involved school teachers having illegal sex with their underage students see mary kay letourneau and debra lafave
lines.name: English

lines.value: male victims including underage minors have been forced to pay child support to their rapist when the rapist conceives a baby as a result of the rape see for example hermesmann v seyer
lines.name: English

lines.value: by masculine gender socialization it is thought that males even younger males cannot be victims of rape nor even that they are vulnerable
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some societies it is considered shameful and unmanly if a male child cries because the male stereotype depicts males as being able to protect themselves which may not always be the case
lines.name: English

lines.value: young boys may be weaker and vulnerable to perpetrators who are usually stronger
lines.name: English

lines.value: the perpetrators can use whatever they have to abuse the child including money or other bribes
lines.name: English

lines.value: an adult male may also be helpless to fight back or fearful of doing so because of the possibility of being arrested for assault and or battery due to social double standards regarding the use of force in self defense between genders in some cases of female perpetrators this double standard is similar to the concern of male self defense against non sexual assault by a female
lines.name: English

lines.value: a common societal belief is that a male must be aroused if he gets an erection or has an orgasm therefore that means that they are willing and enjoying any sexual activity
lines.name: English

lines.value: roy j levin and willy van berlo wrote in an article in the journal of clinical forensic medicine that slight genital stimulation or stress can create erections even though no specific sexual stimulation is present an erection does not mean that the men consent to sex
lines.name: English

lines.value: males can get erections even in traumatic or painful sexual situations and this does not indicate consent
lines.name: English

lines.value: much like female erectile response male erectile response is involuntary meaning that a man need not be aroused for his penis to become erect mechanical stimulation is all that is necessary
lines.name: English

lines.value: arousal and stimulation are distinct things
lines.name: English

lines.value: stimulation is a physical response to a stimulus
lines.name: English

lines.value: men can be physically stimulated without feeling aroused and thus causing an erection
lines.name: English

lines.value: men can be scared and intimidated into an erection especially if the person is older or an authority
lines.name: English

lines.value: one notion is that males are less traumatized by the abuse experience than females are this includes the belief that males are less negatively affected
lines.name: English

lines.value: studies show that the long term effects are damaging for either sex and males may especially be more damaged by social stigma and disbelief of their victimization
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is noted by eogan and richardson that male victims tend to feel more intense anger than female victims while both go through similar feelings of distress after the rape
lines.name: English

lines.value: frazier 1993 studied 74 male and 1380 female rape victims
lines.name: English

lines.value: she found that the depression and hostility are more profound on male victims immediately post rape than female victims
lines.name: English

lines.value: trauma recovery counselor stephanie baird says men who experience sexual attention as children often explain it to themselves as i'm a stud i got laid by ".
lines.name: English

lines.value: baird explains that they do this in order to feel as if they had some power and say
lines.name: English

lines.value: carpenter 2009 citing mezey 1987 finds that the male coping strategy characterized by denial and control renders them more prone to later psychiatric problems and reduces the likelihood of seeking help
lines.name: English

lines.value: henry leak the chairman of the survivors organization stated that rape of males as with females has more to do with power than sexuality and does not only happen inside the homosexual community
lines.name: English

lines.value: sexual orientation is a complex issue and the majority of male perpetrators who seek out boys are not homosexual
lines.name: English

lines.value: male sexual assault victims often fear being seen as gay or weak or believe that their assault may be due to their appearance being effeminate or homosexual so as to attract other males
lines.name: English

lines.value: experts do not believe that premature sexual experiences play a significant role in later sexual orientation
lines.name: English

lines.value: research by jane gilgun judith becker and john hunter states that while many perpetrators may have experienced sexual abuse of their own most sexual assault victims will not go on to become adolescent perpetrators
lines.name: English

lines.value: rape of males during wartime has been reported as being very prevalent in some parts of the world such as democratic republic of congo
lines.name: English

lines.value: many male refugees who have escaped from the civil war in congo to uganda have been raped
lines.name: English

lines.value: across africa men who are raped often face social stigmatization accusations of homosexuality which is illegal in many countries of the region and being ridiculed for being weak and failing to prevent the rape
lines.name: English

lines.value: in northern uganda in recent years there have been ongoing attacks by rebel groups against the government forces

lines.value: the fbi's uniform crime report in 2012 redefined rape as the penetration no matter how slight of the vagina or anus with any body part or object or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person without the consent of the victim the prior definition had not changed since 1927 and gained the attention of sexual assault awareness groups because it had alienated the victims who did not fit the definition - "the carnal knowledge of a female forcibly and against her will

lines.value: the former definition of forcible rape focused on vaginal penetration but the newer definition includes forcible anal or oral penetration

lines.value: the old definition the carnal knowledge of a female forcibly and against her will did not include forcible oral or anal penetration the rape of women with other objects or the rape of a man

lines.value: this new definition encourages male rape victims to seek the help they need and also includes sexual assaults that previously were not covered by the definition of rape

lines.value: the macintosh se was a personal computer designed manufactured and sold by apple computer inc from march 1987 to october 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: it marked a significant improvement on the macintosh plus design and was introduced by apple at the same time as the macintosh ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: the se retains the same compact macintosh form factor as the original macintosh computer introduced three years earlier but with slight differences in color and styling
lines.name: English

lines.value: an enhanced model the se/30 was introduced in january 1989 sales of the original se continued with an update following in august of that year to include a superdrive
lines.name: English

lines.value: the macintosh se was replaced with the macintosh classic a very similar model which retained the same central processing unit and form factor but at a lower price point
lines.name: English

lines.value: the macintosh se was introduced at the appleworld conference in los angeles on march 2 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: the se is an acronym for system expansion
lines.name: English

lines.value: its notable new features compared to its similar predecessor the macintosh plus were apple produced ten ses with transparent cases as prototypes for promotional shots and employees
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are extremely rare and command a premium price for collectors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the macintosh se shipped with system 4.0 and finder 5.4 this version is specific to this computer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the macintosh ii which was announced at the same time but shipped a month later includes system 4.1 and finder 5.5 the readme file included with the installation disks for the se and ii is the first place apple ever used the term macintosh system software and after 1998 these two versions were retroactively given the name macintosh system software 2.0.1
lines.name: English

lines.value: processor motorola 68000 8 mhz with an 8 mhz system bus and a 16-bit data path ram the se came with 1 mb of ram as standard and is expandable to 4 mb
lines.name: English

lines.value: the logic board has four 30-pin simm slots memory must be installed in pairs and must be 150 ns or faster
lines.name: English

lines.value: video there is 256 kb of onboard video memory enabling 512x384 monochrome resolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: the built in screen has a lower resolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: storage the se can accommodate either one or two floppy drives or a floppy drive and a hard drive
lines.name: English

lines.value: after market brackets were designed to allow the se to accommodate two floppy drives as well as a hard drive however it was not a configuration supported by apple
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition an external floppy disk drive may also be connected making the se the only macintosh besides the macintosh portable and macintosh ii which could support three floppy drives though its increased storage ram capacity and optional internal hard drive rendered the external drives less of a necessity than for its predecessors
lines.name: English

lines.value: single floppy se models also featured a drive access light in the spot where the second floppy drive would be
lines.name: English

lines.value: hard drive equipped models came with a 20 mb scsi hard disk.battery located on the logic board is a 3.6 v lithium battery which must be present in order for basic settings to persist between power cycles
lines.name: English

lines.value: macintosh se machines which have sat for a long time have experienced battery corrosion and leakage resulting in a damaged case and logic board.expansion a processor direct slot on the logic board allows for expansion cards such as accelerators to be installed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the se can be upgraded to 50 mhz and more than 5 mb with the micromac accelerators
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the past other accelerators were also available such as the sonnet allegro
lines.name: English

lines.value: since installing a card required opening the computer's case and exposing the user to high voltages from the internal crt apple recommended that only authorized apple dealers install the cards the case was sealed with then uncommon torx screws
lines.name: English

lines.value: upgrades after apple introduced the macintosh se/30 in january 1989 a logic board upgrade was sold by apple dealers as a high cost upgrade for the se consisting of a new se/30 motherboard case front and internal chassis to accommodate the upgrade components
lines.name: English

lines.value: easter egg the macintosh se rom size increased from 64 kb in the original mac to 256 kb which allowed the development team to include an easter egg hidden in the roms
lines.name: English

lines.value: by jumping to address 0x41d89a or reading from the rom chips it is possible to display the four images of the engineering team
lines.name: English

lines.value: introduced march 2 1987 * macintosh se introduced august 1 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: * mini vmac

lines.value: operation jedburgh was a clandestine operation during world war ii in which personnel of the british special operations executive the us office of strategic services the free french bureau central de renseignements et d'action intelligence and operations central bureau and the dutch and belgian armies were dropped by parachute into occupied france the netherlands and belgium to conduct sabotage and guerrilla warfare and to lead the local resistance forces in actions against the germans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name of the operation was chosen at random from a ministry of defence code book although several of those who took part in the operation later reflected that the name was apt as the town of jedburgh in the scottish borders was notorious in the late middle ages for the activities of the raiders known as the border reivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: operation jedburgh represented the first real cooperation in europe between soe and the special operations branch of oss
lines.name: English

lines.value: by this period in the war soe had insufficient resources to mount the huge operation on its own for example it had access to only 23 handley page halifax aircraft for dropping agents and stores barely sufficient to maintain soe's existing networks
lines.name: English

lines.value: oss was able to augment this force with consolidated b 24 liberator aircraft operating from raf harrington see operation carpetbagger
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oss eagerly sought to be involved since in a single swoop it got more agents into northwestern europe than it had during the entire previous period of the united states involvement in the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless general eisenhower the american supreme commander ensured that the french would lead the operation and gave them command on 9 june 1944 of the jedburgh teams in france
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jedburgh teams were known by codenames which usually were first names such as hugh with some names of medicines such as novocaine and a few random names thrown in to confuse german intelligence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the teams normally consisted of three men a commander an executive officer and a non commissioned radio operator
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the officers would be british or american while the other would originate from the country to which the team deployed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the radio operator could be of any nationality
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 300 jeds were selected
lines.name: English

lines.value: after about two weeks of paramilitary training at commando training bases in the scottish highlands they moved to milton hall near peterborough which was much closer to the airfields from which they were to be launched and to london and special force headquarters
lines.name: English

lines.value: at milton hall they received an intensive course in unarmed combat and sabotage techniques
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to their personal weapons which included an m1 carbine and a colt automatic pistol for each member and sabotage equipment the teams dropped with the type b mark ii radio more commonly referred to as the b2 or jed set which was critical for communicating with special force headquarters in london
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were also issued pieces of silk with five hundred phrases that they were likely to use in radio traffic replaced with four letter codes to save time in transmission and one time pads to encipher their messages
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the jedburgh teams mission was to inspire overt rather than clandestine resistance activity they wore military uniform and were equipped with a variety of personal equipment such as medical supplies food such as k and c ration packs sleeping bags field glasses and detailed maps of their operational areas which were printed on silk like their radio ciphers
lines.name: English

lines.value: agents who had previously been dropped to resistance groups had carried only a gun a spade to bury their parachute and false papers
lines.name: English

lines.value: , transcribed from french wikipedia the first team in codenamed hugh parachuted into central france near chateauroux the night before the allied landings in normandy codenamed operation overlord
lines.name: English

lines.value: in total 93 jedburgh teams operated in 54 french metropolitan departements between june and december 1944
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jedburgh teams normally parachuted in by night to meet a reception committee from a local resistance or maquis group
lines.name: English

lines.value: their main function was to provide a link between the guerrillas and the allied command
lines.name: English

lines.value: they could provide liaison advice expertise and leadership but their most powerful asset was their ability to arrange airdrops of arms and ammunition
lines.name: English

lines.value: like all allied forces who operated behind nazi lines the jedburghs were subject to torture and execution in the event of capture under hitler's notorious commando order
lines.name: English

lines.value: because the teams normally operated in uniform to apply this order to them was a war crime
lines.name: English

lines.value: however of the jedburgh teams dropped into france only british captain victor a gough met that fate being shot while a prisoner on 25 november 1944
lines.name: English

lines.value: from september 1944 to april 1945 eight jedburgh teams were active in the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first team code named dudley was parachuted into the east of the netherlands one week before operation market garden
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next four teams were attached to the airborne forces that carried out market garden
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the failure of market garden one jedburgh team trained former resistance men in the liberated south of the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 1945 the last two dutch jedburgh teams became operational
lines.name: English

lines.value: one team code named gambling was a combined jedburgh/special air service sas group that was dropped into the centre of the netherlands to assist the allied advance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last team was parachuted into the northern netherlands as part of sas operation amherst
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the fact that operating clandestinely in the flat and densely populated netherlands was very difficult for the jedburghs the teams were quite successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: jedburgh teams or parties organised on a similar basis also operated under the command of lord mountbatten in the south east asia command seac areas in 1945 including japanese occupied french indo china where sixty french jedburghs joined the newly created corps leger d'intervention c.l.i fighting the japanese occupation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in burma jedburgh teams were used in operations billet and character
lines.name: English

lines.value: billet was a plan to raise resistance to the japanese among the majority burman population primarily through the largely communist anti fascist organisation afo
lines.name: English

lines.value: character was a scheme to raise the minority karen people in the karen hills between the sittang and salween rivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first jeds to go on character operations were flown into burma in february 1945 with lieutenant colonel peacock's special groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the surviving american jeds later held various positions of great responsibility in the us army or the cia
lines.name: English

lines.value: examples include william colby who became director of the cia lucien conein who was a key cia officer in vietnam general john singlaub and colonel aaron bank first commander of united states army special forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: among french jedburghs were paul aussaresses later founder of the sdece's 11e rpc and counter insurgency expert in french algeria jean sassi another who later served in the 11e rpc who pioneered conventional guerrilla commandos gcma with roger trinquier during the first indochina war guy le borgne commander of the 8e choc parachute battalion in indochina the 3rd marine infantry parachute regiment in algeria and 11th parachute division
lines.name: English

lines.value: in you're stepping on my cloak and dagger a memoir of his offbeat adventures as an agent in the oss roger wolcott hall describes his work with the jedburghs
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall's first assignment with the oss was as a special operations instructor at the congressional country club in maryland which had been converted into a training center
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall trained several classes of oss recruits from which american members of the jedburghs were later chosen
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall instructed the recruits in special operations tactics and demolition often leading them on simulated night raids on the country club's golf course
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall himself was supposed to be the leader of a jedburgh team that would parachute into denmark and conduct special operations behind enemy lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the operation was cancelled when someone in the oss discovered that denmark is as flat as a pancake
lines.name: English

lines.value: there's very little natural ground cover
lines.name: English

lines.value: a special operations team [in occupied german territory] would be lucky to last 72 hours there in 1944 while stationed in england hall was assigned to join a jedburgh team in occupied france and coordinate resistance operations following the d day invasion
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the operation did not go as planned
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall parachuted into france and linked up with the jedburgh team only to discover that a sudden offensive by general george s patton's tank divisions had pushed through the area a few hours before and he had landed in friendly territory
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall was back in london two days later
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the historical fiction book war and remembrance and its television miniseries the fictional character leslie slote joined the jedburghs leading a team to organize french resistance
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was killed in an ambush
lines.name: English

lines.value: the knole settee sometimes known as the knole sofa was made in the 17th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is housed at knole in kent a house owned by the sackville wests since 1605 but now in the care of the national trust
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was originally used not as comfortable sofa but as a formal throne on which the monarch would have sat to receive visitors

lines.value: the hot five was louis armstrong's first jazz recording band led under his own name
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was a typical new orleans jazz band in instrumentation consisting of trumpet clarinet and trombone backed by a rhythm section
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original new orleans jazz style leaned heavily on collective improvisation in which the three horns together played the lead the trumpet played the main melody and the clarinet and trombone played improvised accompaniments to the melody
lines.name: English

lines.value: this tradition was continued in the hot five but because of armstrong's creative gifts as a trumpet player solo passages by the trumpet alone began to appear more frequently
lines.name: English

lines.value: in these solos armstrong laid down the basic vocabulary of jazz improvisation and became its founding and most influential exponent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hot five was organized at the suggestion of richard m jones for okeh records
lines.name: English

lines.value: all their records were made in okeh's recording studio in chicago illinois
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same personnel recorded a session made under the pseudonym lil's hotshots for vocalion/brunswick
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the musicians in the hot five played together in other contexts as the hot five they were a recording studio band that performed live only for two parties organized by okeh
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were two different groups called louis armstrong and his hot five the first recording from 1925 through 1927 and the second in 1928 armstrong was the only musician in both groups
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original hot five were armstrong's wife pianist lil hardin armstrong as well as new orleans musicians who armstrong had worked with in that city in the 1910s kid ory on trombone johnny dodds on clarinet and johnny st cyr on guitar and banjo
lines.name: English

lines.value: for some or all of the louis armstrong and his hot seven sides ory was in new york city working with king oliver's band and was replaced probably by john thomas
lines.name: English

lines.value: in one session in december 1927 lonnie johnson was added on guitar
lines.name: English

lines.value: the recordings of this group are considered by many to be uneven with some of the blunders e.g the mistimed hokum at the end of heebie jeebies becoming notorious in jazz circles and the solos of dodds ory and hardin sounding pedestrian in comparison with armstrong's
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the ensemble passages are frequently effective and the genius of armstrong's cornet or trumpet playing touch virtually every recording
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the more important examples are cornet chop suey muskrat ramble hotter than that and strutting with some barbecue
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1928 armstrong revamped the recording band replacing everyone but himself with members of the carroll dickerson orchestra in which armstrong was playing fred robinson on trombone jimmy strong on clarinet and tenor saxophone earl hines on piano mancy carr not cara as has often been misprinted on banjo and zutty singleton on drums
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1928 hot five played music that was specifically arranged as opposed to the more freewheeling improvised passages of the earlier hot five
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tentative movement toward the kind of fully arranged horn sections that would dominate swing music a decade later was starting to become fashionable and this second armstrong group embraced a rudimentary version of it with don redman as arranger providing some written out section parts
lines.name: English

lines.value: strong on clarinet and robinson on trombone were not as strong soloists as dodds and ory had been with the earlier band but hines was more nearly armstong's equal technically and creatively than any other in either band
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus these sessions resulted in some of the most important masterpieces of early jazz of which west end blues is arguably the best known
lines.name: English

lines.value: other important recordings include basin street blues tight like this saint james infirmary and weather bird
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the last named only armstrong and hines are present turning an old rag number into a tour de force duet
lines.name: English

lines.value: in ball playing competitive team sports an interception or pick is a move by a player involving a pass of the ball whether by foot or hand depending on the rules of the sport in which the ball is intended for a player of the same team but caught by a player of the opposing team who thereby usually gains possession of the ball for their team
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is commonly seen in football including canadian and american football as well as association football rugby league rugby union australian rules football and gaelic football as well as any sport by which a loose object is passed between players toward a goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in american or canadian football an interception occurs when a forward pass is caught by a player of the opposing defensive team
lines.name: English

lines.value: this leads to an immediate change of possession during the play the defender who caught the ball immediately attempts to move the ball as far towards the opposing end zone as possible
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the stoppage of play if the interceptor retained possession of the ball his team takes over possession at the spot where he was downed
lines.name: English

lines.value: interceptions are predominantly made by the secondary or on some occasions the linebackers who are usually closest to the quarterback's intended targets the wide receivers running backs and tight ends
lines.name: English

lines.value: less frequently a defensive lineman may get an interception from a tipped ball a near sack a shovel pass or a screen pass but are more likely to force a fumble than get an interception
lines.name: English

lines.value: as soon as a pass is intercepted everyone on the defense immediately acts as blockers helping the person with the interception get as much yardage as possible and perhaps a touchdown commonly called a pick six at the same time everyone on the offense becomes the defense and may attempt to tackle the ball carrier
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the interception occurs on an extra point attempt rather than an ordinary play from scrimmage a potential return of the interception to the other end zone is sometimes called a pick two as it would be a defensive two point conversion rather than a touchdown
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example on december 4 2016 the kansas city chiefs strong safety eric berry scored the game winning points via a pick two in a 29 28 victory over the atlanta falcons
lines.name: English

lines.value: berry also achieved an ordinary pick six earlier in the same game
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the intercepting team can run out the clock the intercepting player may down the ball immediately and not attempt to gain any yardage
lines.name: English

lines.value: this eliminates the chance of a fumble that could be recovered by the other team
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also player safety implications when the ball is turned over the play is now suddenly and unexpectedly moving in the opposite direction
lines.name: English

lines.value: all of the players on offense are instantly susceptible to unexpected blocks even if not attempting to stop the ball carrier a hard and unseen block can result in severe injuries
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally offensive players particularly the quarterback are often inexperienced tacklers and are at risk of injuring themselves while tackling the ball carrier
lines.name: English

lines.value: only the interception of a forward pass is recorded statistically as an interception for both the passer and the intercepting player
lines.name: English

lines.value: if a receiver fails to catch the ball and bobbles or tips it before it is intercepted even if his action was entirely responsible for the interception it is always recorded as an interception thrown by the passer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the interception of a lateral pass is recorded as a fumble by the passer
lines.name: English

lines.value: lester hayes of the oakland raiders was one of the national football league's nfl leaders at interceptions in the late 1970s and early 1980s

lines.value: after the nfl outlawed the use of such foreign substances in 1981 hayes success rate at interceptions dropped below average though that could be due to his reputation as a shutdown cornerback which discouraged opposing teams from throwing to his side of the field

lines.value: he continued to use the substance which he called pick juice by having it applied in smaller amounts to his wrists

lines.value: thomas peter thorvald kristian ferdinand mortensen 16 august 1882 &ndash 25 april 1998 known as an adult as christian mortensen was a danish american supercentenarian
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he died his age of 115 years 252 days was the longest verified lifespan of any male in modern history until 28 december 2012 when jiroemon kimura of japan surpassed this record
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen was the first man confirmed to reach age 115 in 1997
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen was baptized in fruering church on december 26 1882
lines.name: English

lines.value: besides his baptismal record other records include the 1890 and 1901 census enumerations in denmark and church confirmation in 1896
lines.name: English

lines.value: christian mortensen was born the son of a tailor in the village of skarup near the city of skanderborg denmark on august 16 1882
lines.name: English

lines.value: he began work as a tailor's apprentice in skanderborg at age 16 in 1898 and later took work as a farmhand
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen emigrated to the united states in 1903 then aged about 20 or 21 years old
lines.name: English

lines.value: he traveled while working as a tailor but settled in chicago where he had relatives
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen worked various trades including as a milkman for borden's milk as a restaurateur and as a factory worker for the continental can company
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was married for less than ten years divorced and had no children
lines.name: English

lines.value: he did not remarry
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1950 mortensen retired near galveston bay texas
lines.name: English

lines.value: then 28 years later at the age of 96 he moved to a retirement home in san rafael california
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen claimed he rode his bicycle to the aldersly retirement community telling the staff that he was there to stay
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen lived at aldersly until his death in 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen enjoyed an occasional cigar and insisted that smoking in moderation was not unhealthy
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen preferred a vegetarian diet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also drank boiled water
lines.name: English

lines.value: mortensen was legally blind towards the end of his life and spent much of his time in a wheelchair listening to the radio
lines.name: English

lines.value: toward the end of his life his memory of distant events was good but he could not remember recent events and increasingly needed assistance from the aldersly staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: on his 115th birthday mortensen gave his advice for a long life friends a good cigar drinking lots of good water no alcohol staying positive and lots of singing will keep you alive for a long time
lines.name: English
